This place is great, good food, friendly service, excellent homemade bloody mary's etc. Fish and chips is great, crepe's are excellent, but the breakfast / brunch menu is awesome - Kahlua dipped french toast, egg's benedict and florentine very well done and great coffee sourced locally from Dilworth Coffee.

We will be back soon...

This is my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  I've been a couple times and find myself craving Crepe Cellar daily. 

The atmosphere and the people are great!  Like Ashley V. said, it is a small restaurant so on any night of the week you could find yourself waiting a while for a table.  But it is SO worth it! 

The Food:  

I had the daily seafood special.  It was a seared tuna steak crusted with some delicious seasonings that I can't recall (cumin could have been one).  It was cooked to perfection!  Nice and crunchy on the outside and red on the inside but still warm.  It flaked apart perfectly!  No knife needed.  And it was a big portion of tuna too - nothing wimpy.  The tuna was sitting on a bed of delicious flavorful risotto.  The plate was topped with 3 asparagus spears and surrounded with ponzu sauce that was soooo good!

For dessert, it was hard to make a decision between the strawberry/nutella crepe and the banana fosters crepe.  I went banana fosters.. The crepe was filled with the delicious rum butter sauce and covered with more of the sauce and cooked bananas.  There was a pretty good sized amount of whipped cream off to the side too.  It was warm, melty and buttery -- I loved every bite of it. 

My bill came out to be $34.00 but that included 2-$4 beers.
Crepe = $7 (one of the more expensive ones)  They range in price from $4-8 depending on add ons like ice cream and extra fruit.
The special was $17 by far the most expensive thing there.  Regular menu items are about $7-10.  

Overall: 
What are you doing still reading this?  You should be at Crepe Cellar right now!  Unless it's Monday - that's the one day they are closed.

I ordered a seasonal crepe, which currently contains Irish cream, bananas, and some other pieces of heaven I can't remember with vanilla bean ice cream on the side!

Because I wasn't feeling too hungry, I only went in for a desert crepe and split with a friend. However, the food there sounds amazing, and I definitely plan on going back with an empty stomach and trying out more things on their menu!

The place is a bit small but has a nice ambiance. I think it would be a great place to consider for a date night.

I was looking forward to trying a crepe however as soon as I sat down my friend said, "So even though this is a crepe place, their crepes suck, get something else." Ok then, what was my next choice? They were voted best fish and chips and best fries in 2011, so I figured I couldn't go wrong. I could most likely eat french fries for my only meal for the rest of my life, so to be voted the best of the best, well.....they need to be pretty unbelievable. I ended up upgrading to the best of 2011 fries with my fish and was sorta disappointed. They were topped with pesto and brie just as the menu says, but I didn't find this to add to their flavor. If anything it took away from the yummy fries that are good just served plain. The fish was excellent. Crispy and fried perfectly. It came with a side of thinly sliced cole slaw which was ok. The service was ok although the waitress shot my friend and me a nasty look for looking at pictures on our phone together, as if we were disturbing her. The place was also very loud and when I mean loud, I had to shout at the person across from me which made me just want to eat in silence and not talk at all. I most likely would come back for the fish and chips and maybe then I'll try a dessert crepe.
Excellent Restaurant.  Great drinks, great dessert crepes.  We didn't try the dinner fare, as we had eaten earlier - but will be going back because everything looked fantastic!

We celebrated my husband's birthday at Crepe Cellar this week.  We've been here a hand full of times and always enjoy the food and the atmosphere.  (Although this night their A/C was out and it was a bit stuffy, but still bearable.)

We started with the cheese and meat platter which was very nice!  3 different additions (fig preserves, strawberry, mustard and crostinis) to the meat and cheese. Next was the flat bread which was actually bread.  I was thinking pizza but nope - more like an open face french bread sandwich - tasty but not exactly what I was expecting.  We also had the Caesar salad which was very heavy on the anchovy.

Service was attentive yet not annoying.  Always a pleasurable experience!!

Food was great! The pesto fries are fantastic with flavor, but are very soggy. So if you're looking for a crispy french fry this is not your option. Burger was outstandingly. The crepe was a bit of a disappoint and lacked a wow factor. 

I will be back

My favorite spot in Charlotte. Artists in the kitchen. Super service. 

Chicken Cassoulet, French Press Coffee (complete with brewing timers in the form of an hourglass) and Bananas Foster with Nutella is the trifecta of cuisine. My wife and I go once a week. Top notch.  Added bonus is the creative vibe of The NODA District.

I usually eat here when I'm doing the NODA gallery crawl. It's a great spot for hanging with friends or a date... good menu, location and atmosphere. It has a nice, cozy feel and the pesto brie fries are SO. GOOD! As a chocolate lover the brownie in a blanket dessert is on my favorite list, too.

We have lived in Noda for 3 years and Crepe has always been our favorite restaurant in Noda. The food is amazing and so is the ambience. The burger and fish and chips are always a go to.  I tried the half chicken last night which was incredible!  We also want to give a special shoutout to our server this weekend.  Emily you were awesome!

Met some friends for lunch when headed from Atlanta to Raleigh for the weekend.  They live in NoDa and picked out the place.  

It's cozy spot with dark wood, specials on the chalk board, an interesting beverage list, and a small but varied menu.  I opted for the crepe special, with broccolini.  The crepe was yummy - filling but not overly so.  It was a nice break from the usual salads and sandwiches that I eat for lunch.

Anyway, there are 2 reasons this place gets the extra star that says I'm a fan - service and soundtrack.  The people were really friendly, gave good suggestions, and very patient with us.  As for the soundtrack, I don't remember the individual songs, but I remember them all being ones that I love and that fall into that category of upbeat in a relaxing way.

All in all, definitely a great lunch spot.

Yes yes yes! If I are a foodie I MUST come to NoDa area of Charlotte and eat here! The cellar burger and Brie fries are off the charts!!! Their French press coffee is pretty amazing as well! NoDa is a very eclectic part of CLT. Be sure to hang around and enjoy the scene as well as the food. Best fries in Charlotte hands down...

Delish! Well, I can only speak for the Spinach and Wild Mushroom Crêpe and the Mascarpone and Berries Crêpe for desert... and they certainly were delicious!
Wonderful atmosphere and ambience! Staff was quite nice, attentive and knowledgeable.
Overall, it was a great experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone who has yet to try this gem in NoDa!

Oh my goodness. I wish I could eat here every. single. day. The menu has more than crepes, but when I go- I go for the Queen City. Absolutely delish! My husband and I go here on occasion and we love it- you really can't go wrong. I love the atmosphere- the "low lighting" and the service. We went there last week- and even though it was packed (not unusual) the hostess was extremely tentative and took our name down on a tablet (new, I think- great idea) and sent us a text message when our table was ready. It sits in a great spot in NoDa- so while you wait you can hit up some of the local bars (Growlers, next door). If you go for dinner you MUST try the Nutella Crepe Brownie for dessert....9/10 we have to take it home and it still tastes amazing the next day. Start off with an app. (any are wonderful) and dive into dinner- SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT! This place is a must if you live in/near/are visiting Charlotte.

The excellent!:

1) service
2) atmosphere
3) location 
4) bang for your buck
5) dessert / ALWAYS order dessert

The mediocre:

1) buck wheat dinner crepe (far too heavy and grain-y) dream of a day they do away with this!
2) tri fold of crepes (limits contents/go with a roll)
3) unnecessary information on specials (details can be great but too much and gets awkward)
4) pesto fries while unique are always burnt

Born in NC I feel I know my grits, biscuits, etc... The biscuits here are flaky, buttery and a good size! The grits are on point! It's rare I don't have to doctor-up my grits (pepper, salt and butter) but these were so well-cooked and seasoned I didn't need to do a thing. 
I tried my friends brussel sprouts and pesto fries and both of those dishes were tasty as well.
The place itself is cool but neighborly; I will definitely be back!

When I won a raffle at a Charlotte Checkers game earlier this season, one of the two prizes was a gift card for Crepe Cellar.  We used it for our early Valentine's Day dinner and we really enjoyed it.  We were also hungry after walking from the near Midtown to Freedom Park and back.  

We arrived in Noda at 5:30 or so.  Like all "this is a cool and older neighborhood", parking can be difficult.  We found a spot in the tiny lot behind the restaurant.  

Upon entering we found a small table for two in the small place.  The place only has a few tables and small bar, but it is somewhat efficient.  I saw they had Heineken on tap (a rarity) and for only $4, I gladly obliged.  My wife had the house red wine which she said was good.

Our waitress, Alex, was very nice.  We started with a cheese plate.  Yummy Maytag, aged cheddar, sliced beef and prosciutto hat actually didn't taste salty.  There was some crostini, strawberries, and candied walnuts too.  The cheese plate could have been a small meal for one person we ordered more.

I had spinach, mushroom, and goat cheese crepe which was very tasty and large.  It was served with fries which were phenomenal.  They were the perfect size, flavor, texture, and crispiness and would have went great with malt vinegar.  My wife had a small salad, cheese grits, and about 1/4 of my crepe.  By this time were stuffed so we did not get dessert ( a few people were also waiting so we wanted to be polite and let them sit down and eat). However I noticed that several desserts are served with Nutella which to me is not good.  There are few things of which I don't like the flavor but hazelnut is one of them.  

All in all, our experience at Crepe Cellar was very good from the food to the service to the drinks to the atmosphere.  I am glad I won that gift card otherwise I may never have tried it.  The prices are also very reasonable with the crepes being $8-9 but you can also get more price items like steak or shrimp and grits.

Crepes for dinner is completely new to me, but I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. I had the crepe du jour which included roasted chicken,  chorizo,  and black beans inside along with the fried brussel sprouts as a side. It was so delicious I never even thought about taking a pic. If you have a sweet tooth, the crepe suzette is a great choice.
Desert crepes are excellent and must have.  Dinner crepes are good but not great.  Mussels were very good as well.  Chimay on tap so cannot beat that.

I have been putting off writing this for a long time. Largely because it is my most visited and most familiar 'special occasion' restaurant. I think it's a lot easier to write about one given experience, but to aggregate dozens of different visits into one straightforward review is a little bit more challenging! Let's give it a go.

First of all, when you walk in you're immersed in a very intimate atmosphere that maybe you weren't expecting in the NoDa neighborhood. This spot is great for friends catching up with each other or date night with your significant other. Seating at the bar is first come first served, while the wait times for dining room seating has improved with recent renovations/expansion to the rear of the restaurant.

I highly suggest the seasonal cocktails they feature on the constantly rotating menu, their bar staff is top notch and they even age their own Burbon!

For starters, if it's your first time here, no question you've got to try the award winning (Charlotte Magazine) pesto brie fries. The pesto that's served with it adds such a bold flavor that contrasts well with the mellow creaminess of the brie, it's a true delight.

Make sure to check out the specials. They do a weekly special crepe, seafood dish, Mussel, soup, and veg, which they list on a board near the back of the restaurant, but your server should go over them as well. Barring any showstoppers on the special menu, I always know what I'm in the mood for: Slow roasted short rib, served with a cabernet reduction, with heirloom tomatoes and roasted shallots. If you think I copied and pasted that from the menu you'd be wrong, I've ordered this so many times it's burned in my brain! Every bite is pure perfection, I'm serious, I could just die right there with no regrets after finishing a plate of this.

You may be wondering where the crepes are in this review. To be honest, I love the entree crepe dishes, but I like to save the crepe for dessert. They make an outstanding crepe suzette with a creamy sauce finished with grand mariner and topped with the most amazing ice cream. I'll say no more, words cannot do this dish any justice.

At the end of the night, before you leave, pause a minute to just savor the atmosphere. Friends and family enjoying each others company, the passers-by reveling in a fun night in NoDa, and the hustle of the amazing kitchen churning out stellar food all blend together like a symphony. It's a curious experience for me every time, and I can't wait to come back.

So glad this place is in our neighborhood!  But please bring back the chicken the way you used to do it!  Shepard's pie is stupid good too, or is it Guiness Pie?  They have great specials and it's like an upscale pub atmosphere. Super friendly staff. They make the experience special. Great for a date!

We went here for dinner this weekend and the wait was about an hour and fifteen minutes, we were able to put our name in and they would just send us a text letting us know our table was ready which is pretty great. That meant we could leave and go to another place for a drink if we had wanted to. Luckily there was room at the bar for us so we ordered a drink and the pesto fries appetizer while we waited. The fries were delicious and the pesto was amazing. So good I decided to order the pesto pasta as my entree and I am so glad I did. The pasta sauce was also very creamy which I loved. My husband ordered the fish and chips and tried a few bites of it as well, it was great with wonderful flaky crust. Their tartar sauce was amazing. My best friend ordered their burger which I didn't try because I don't eat beef but she said it was delicious. I will be going here again in the future.

One of the best additions to the NoDa neighborhood over the last year or so.
If you are going the crepe route for dining, hit up the Queen City.  If you are going for dessert, you cannot go wrong with the brownie concoction.
The menu is also delicious well beyond the crepe realm.  The steak and Guiness stew with the insanely good mac and cheese will hit the spot.  For lighter fare, I recommend the pesto chicken french bread pizza.
The beer selection (especially on tap) is always evolving and refreshing no matter what your taste.
The wait staff and bartenders are friendly and fun.

Nice atmosphere with very good service.  Interesting menu.  Not just creeps.  Not a fan of buckwheat flour which is what all their savory creeps are made from.    I had the ham and guryere creep which need something else to make it different.  I can make ham and cheese at home.  Fries were over cooked.  I will try it again because they have lovely ingredients.  Sam P.
Omg this place is a hidden gem!!! Best food and specials!! My new fav!!! You won't be disappointed

We probably go here once a month. Great neighborhood, good food and great beers and wine by the glass, all at a reasonable price. It's one of our few go-to's that isn't in the super pricey category.  Park across the street behind the building with the Fifth Third bank in it if you can't find space on the street or in the small lot behind the restaurant.  Cool kids pass their ticket to those coming in and save a new friend the $5!

Atmosphere is cozy and casual. Have been there plenty of times when all tables are full and never too loud. 

French onion soup is a good preparation and the bowl is a massive cheesy crock of goodness. 

Steak frites with Hangar steak as the cut is delicious. Always order med rare and it always comes out that way. Fries are delicious hand cut shoestrings. Great pan sauce served atop. Always a winner and fairly priced around $23. Very big portion. 

I love the burger there. Fancy cheese and crispy fried onion strings. Great bun and served with the aforementioned fries for $12 is a good one. 

Daily muscles special that works well as a big app or a small dinner. Never had a bad one and they serve with nice crusty bread to sop up the sauce. 

Beer list is always impressive and changing, and I like that they have a lengthy list of wines by the glass all for $6.

Crepes Suzette for desert is so, so good.  Not too sweet and have to try a crepe when you're there.
Excellent food. Queen City crepe, Guinness pie, fish and chips all delicious. Great draft beer menu. Cool relaxed atmosphere and service is good.
Outstanding desserts!  We went for a walk to find something different and found it!  The brownie crepe was decadent and the Orange chocolate moose was light as air.  Delicious!

Great atmosphere, good service, and good food. Don't forget to check out the specials on the chalk board. The burger is unexpectedly good for a place called the Crepe Place. Also don't leave without trying one of the deserts.
The Banana Foster's in the Bomb Digity times infinity!!

Crepe Cellar has an awesome ambiance.  I love the cozy feel with exposed wood and chalkboard specials on the wall. The service is top-notch with knowledgeable, friendley servers and talented bartenders.  

But, for a crepe restaurant, I really don't care for their crepes.  I find them somewhat dry and a bit bland.  I do, however, like the rest of their menu quite a bit.  They have a mussels special everyday that never disappoints.  There's a flatbread pizza special that is enjoyable.  The arugula salad with balsamic, fig dressing is a-mazing.  

It can get busy here, but I can consistently get a table without a wait if I go early-ish (like 5:30).  If you have a wait, there's plenty of places in NoDa to enjoy a drink before your dinner.

Wow. I've been here before and it was great, but the last couple of visits were not great.  The cheese plate flavors do not blend at all.  It used to be so good. The onion soup had very little flavor, just a sprinkle of cheese, and tasted gelatin like. Half the mussels were closed on the plate and in general it seemed like the chef was doing a lot of shopping at Costcos. I've become acustomed to better from this place. hope to see some change for the better again!

I have only been here during lunch hours so that is what my review is based on. 

I have been here multiple times and each time it was a fantastic experience. The service has always been great. The beer selection is pretty good, though the last time I was here ti wasnt as good. I have been when it was really busy and when we were the only ones in there and still get the same great service. 

I have had the pesto brie fries a few times and they were really good each time. Some of the best Pesto i have ever had. 

The burger is great, not a huge fan of aioli so i get it without, and has tasted fresh and great every time. I have had it with and without bacon and prefer it without bacon. The bacon takes away from the flavor for some reason. 

My absolute favorite food here is their Mac and Cheese. Now I am extremely picky when it comes to Mac and Cheese and theirs is amazing. I have had it almost every time and it is always great. I do prefer to eat it hot and not let it cool so much. 

I have had the bananna fosters crepe as well and it was good. It was a little different than I expected so I think it caught me off guard but it was good and I would eat it again. 

Give the place a try!

What an amazing find for breakfast and lunch. I cannot remember when I have had coffee so good it made me stop conversation and take notice. The French press coffee comes with its own timer so you can brew it perfectly to your tastes. The food is exceptional. (we plan to here tomorrow, it's that good). We opted for two of the savory buckwheat crepes. The turkey apple brie is perfectly balance the the light and delicate flavors all complementing each other. The ham and Gruyere cheese with the maple Dijon glaze was hearty and flavorful. The chef is obviously a musician creating a symphony of flavors! The sides were good enough to be stand alone. Definitely try the purple slaw and if you love brussel sprouts, they are a must. We did not try any of the home craft cocktails but the menu was impressive.

Really...really delicious crepes.  I had the Turkey Apple Brie Buckwheat crepe. So good. And the service was great too! Parking is difficult to find, but drive around until you find a spot. This place is worth it! I will definitely be back.

Sunday lunch here - I went for the eggs Benedict, my date had the buckwheat crepe with salmon. We had mimosas to accompany the meal. Everything was really good. We started with the flash fried Brussels sprouts which were a great choice, and we had sides of the home fries (cooked to perfection), and cheese grits.  I did start with a Bloody Mary, which ended too spicy for me, but our serve Dustin was very nice about it and took care of us. He also had great menu recommendations!  Thanks Dustin!

We were too full for dessert, so we will have to make a special visit for that!
Best burger of my life!!!  The Mac and cheese was to die for as well.  I will definitely be back

Out of curiosity I will return, but not in a hurry.  I am pretty sure I have had real crepes before and they were not supposed to be mushy and thick.  It's supposed to be thin, light, and crisp.  I loved the drink menu; lots of great wines, beers, ciders, etc. and at reasonable prices.  I am actually more intrigued by their soups and appetizers.  A really delicous looking salad came out while I was picking over my dough ball pillow crepe with ham tucked somewhere inside.  I brought my leftovers home and put them on the foreman grill and it tasted much better.  The ambience and decor is really dark and romantic; I think it would make a great first date location.  The irony is I just did not like the crepes...

After an initial bout of extreme disappointment learning the fryers were down when we arrived, we decided to stick around. i had planned on getting Fish and Chips  and/or Pesto Brie French Fries so that was a no go. Instead i went with an actual crepe (my first ever?), it appears to be like the French version of a quesadilla or your standard American wrap. I did enjoy it and would probably recommend it. It was the Queen City with chicken, bacon, cheddar and a tasty sauce. Each bite was flavorful. As my side i ordered the corn and zucchini succotash which they did charge $1 upgrade from the fries that come with it despite the fries not being available. Whatever. And yes, i was called out as i was about to say "sufferin succotash." Come on, how could you not be thinking it.  

Sampled the mac n cheese and it just wasn't for me. Maybe it wasn't my kind of cheese but it seemed extremely bland, blah and drab. The steak and Guinness Pie was good. i was just sampling it, but would like for the veggies to be bigger or more plentiful.

The banana fosters was alright, the banana parts were good, but it's just not my favorite type of dessert and actually wouldn't be in my first ten choices for dessert.  

The place does have limited seating and while we were eating during their transition to dinner time it appeared one of the tables that sat down was forgotten about as the servers changed. Seems tough to do with the limited number of tables.All the tables were full and i almost felt bad that we had gotten dessert and were finishing the coffee as people stood a few feet away waiting on a table. 
Seriously, does every restaurant have to have a tv?

These are Huge Crepes!

Twice I have eaten Crepes Suzette twice here!  Both times as a Dessert!!!  I would eat this as a meal and would not be bragging about it (not be bragging that it was a meal for a person who is always on a "diet" - always BREAKING a diet)!  I'm guessing this is the Best Dessert in NoDa?  Best one I remember and only one I am suggesting right now!

Once we had a Crepe with Sausage was very good too!  We may have asked for the Sausage to be added!

Same Dude Severed us each time and does a great job!

Very Comfortable place!  Nicer than my Apartment for sure! Usually we get here before the Crowd!

Came by for lunch on a Friday and found great lunch specials, great beer and wine options, local coffee and tea, and delicious food. The crepes are huge and the sides are generous. Everything was very fresh. Great atmosphere and decor, fantastic service.

Not only great atmosphere and food, but excellent service too!

It was out first time going out to NoDa for the studio crawl and we saw this little gem on our adventure. It is an intimate space perfect for families, small get-togethers and dates. Definitely somewhere I would take newcomers.

After putting our name down on the electronic waitlist, we were accidentally notified our table was ready. But we waited patiently outside until another table was available. A few minutes later we were brought inside and given an appetizer on the house. Not that it was an inconvenience at all, but it was a very generous gesture and worth the wait. We had the notable pesto brie fries--delicious especially for the french fry fanatics.

AND I accidentally left my cellphone on the table. And instead of having lost it for the night [or possibly forever] I was chased down and given it back. The best.

Must visit on so many different levels!
Overall pretty good - nice variety of offerings - my complete review: http://tastefullygigi.blogspot.com/

Finally made it for dinner with friends! I was the only first timer and happy to learn about the special under $25 wine list. We split two bottles among 5 of us and it was the perfect amount. To shared the burrata start, it was creamy flavorful and the perfect compliment to the grilled bread. Our waiter was nice enough to make sure we had extra bread so that we could all share. I had the spinach and wild mushroom crepe, while I appreciated that they use buckwheat for their savory crepes I didn't find this to be the best or most authentic rendition, however it was good. I paired it with the house salad, which was plentiful for a side portion, and quite fresh and delicious. Another friend ordered the crepe stuffed with a brownie and topped with ice cream, I had a bite and it was amazing, the brownie was so moist! Overall, we had a wonderful time and everyone was pleased with the food and service. It worked out well for a small group but also has an intimate vibe that would be great for a date or special occasion. I look forward to returning!

What a Great atmosphere for a date. Worth checking out purely for the lighting (go at night for dinner!). The drinks are good and my hat's off to the cooks. Definitely thumbs up on just about everything, especially service. Really worth checking out if you're looking for something different. Not sure what to recommend purely because everything is so different... it really comes down to your personal taste. 

I'd definitely go here again. Only downside is parking can get competitive in NODA depending on when you go, so you might have to walk a little unless you get lucky.

5 star for the Pesto Bri Cheese fries which is a new favorite among appetizers in Charlotte

4 star for the rest of the food 

We split the Queen City crepe which had roasted chicken, bacon, cheddar, tomatoes and an oven roasted tomato dressing. Also got the beef short rib over potato herb gnocchi with roasted tomatoes, shallots, and Cabernet reduction. 

Awesome music, great service, and good atmosphere

I absolutely loved the atmosphere and the decor of the restaurant. Very clean and friendly wait staff, and they were also prompt for a Wednesday dinner time. The food was delicious. I recommend the Queen City crepes with fries. The draft selection was mediocre, but I could pick out some of my go to brews. Great place for lunch and dinner.

P.E.I Muscles were AMAZING! Huge portion for $14 can't beat it. It had bacon & apples in a white wine cream sauce, absolutely to die for! I also got the spinach and wild mushroom crepe it was excellent as well. Can't wait to return and try desert!

Another first visit on my Charlotte cuisine bucket list.  Without a reservation policy, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't difficult to seat my party of five; mostly set up for 4-tops. Great selections, presentations & taste!  Staff was friendly once they warmed up to you.  Recommend for a neighborly experience; free on-street parking.

I'm not one to write negative reviews, but this evening I was very disappointed in the service here. My boyfriend & I have frequented here 2 times before. We were very pleased with everything. However tonight, when I was solo, I sat at the bar. I wasn't acknowledged until 5 minutes later. After that,  I was told by the bartender that I would receive a water while I browsed the wine list. 12 minutes later, a couple beside of me received waters before I did, while the bartender was their making their cocktails. After several minutes of waiting, with only a menu and no drink or water.  I hope that this was just a really off night, because I'm sure that's not normal.

Really good food but horrible service. Our waitress constantly ignored us and every other table in the place. Didn't refill drinks, walked right past us with the pitcher of water, circled the room with it, yet refilled nothing. Waited over ten minutes to get a box that i had to ask the other waitress for and then another ten to get the check. Although i made eye contact with the cooks in the back of the house about six times letting them know i was ready the message did not get passed on. The only thing this waitress did do was talk and talk and talk to her coworkers about Matthew Mcconaughey  with her back towards the customers. If you want to eat here get it to go. Great food but i will not come back.

The food here is creative and very rich. Be prepared to not only eat a unique meal but also to pack in hundreds of calories, perhaps pushing past a thousand! Located in the little hipster nabe Noda (dumb NY wannabe real estate names that stick...sigh), which, despite its name IS cool, especially for the CLT. 

My party and I started with the pesto fries, which I'm less sure were "pesto" proper than the ingredients of pesto infused into the fries. A delicious, greasy snack. We also had the brussel sprouts which were fantastic. Less great was the shrimp something in a cup and a loaf of baked bread. Wasn't quite sure what was supposed to go on there. Shrimp something on the bread? It was okay, just unclear what I was eating (and probably partly my fault as I didn't order it!)

With my meal, which was the burger, which was fine and straight down the middle of the plate, I had a Scottish IPA, which was very good.

Overall, the service here was kind, friendly, and good. Not "hipster" service at all (which would be aloof and too cool and annoyed that I have to even work here at all to supplement the support of my self-indulgent hobbies-ZING!).

My boyfriend and I ended up here at nearly 11:30 pm on a Saturday night. It wasn't crowded but the atmosphere was lively. We had wanted to get a drink and dessert, but when we were told the kitchen closed at 11pm, we hesitated but decided to get a drink anyway. Alex (the bartender) told us to hold on while she double-checked with the kitchen, and when she came back, she told us that the kitchen would make a dessert for us, which was a very nice surprise. 

We ordered the Brownie in a Blanket, and WOW. If you're looking for a decadent dessert at the end of a rough day, this dessert will make all your troubles go away. The crepes were perfectly cooked, and the Nutella, brownie and candied walnuts were an exceptional addition to them. They went very well with my perfectly-made Old Fashioned too! All in all, a wonderful first-time visit to Crepe Cellar. I will definitely be back for dinner sometime soon!
Pretty good breakfast crepe. Love the atmosphere and neighborhood. Great spot for brunch.

If nothing else, get the pesto Brie fries. Please!! The bar staff are extremely friendly, which only added to the experience. Also got the burrata which is house made by the chef, and well made at that. Definitely give this place a try next time you're in NoDa.

I came for a week visit in north carolina, my friends took me to this place and it was amazing. I ordered the sausage baguette pizza and pest brie fries with a nice white wine. everything was delish. next time i come to charlotte i must come here. Service was also nice and friendly. The brownie dessert crepe was to die for..

My boyfriend and I visit charlotte for a few days and had dinner at this hidden gem.  I had the ham and guryere crepe with a side of mac and cheese (the bomb), my boyfriend got the arugula salad with salmon.  The food and service was fantastic.  Alex was our waitress and she was the sweetest thing ever!  She was knowledgeable and I was never without a drink.  A must try place!

This place is a small cozy little crepe cafe with a good atmosphere and good crepes. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and we each ordered a crepe each even after having dinner already.  It was a sweet and delightful banana and nutella crepe which I enjoyed very much.  

I wish i knew the restaurant served savory dishes as well, then I wouldn't of had dinner at some other place before stumbling upon this gem!

Excellent lunch. Will definitely go back.

Parking can be a challenge, but worth it.

My husband and I ended up here after Cabo Fish Taco told us there would be a 30 min wait. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in The Crepe Cellar. Beautiful and simple decor. Cozy. Nice bar. Not loud like Cabo. Our server Katherine was knowledgeable and relaxed. She was very nice too! She told us all of her favorites and we chose to start with steamed mussels, endive salad and had burgers for our meal. They were all killer. 

Don't let the name mislead you- they have all kinds of other amazing food other than crepes. All of the food we tried was fantastic, perfectly cooked and served promptly. Perfect date night spot where you can actually hear your date talk without having to shout. The only small complaint I have is that because our table was in the aisle servers kept bumping into the back of my chair each time they passed. Next time I'll ask for a booth ;-)

One of the most interesting food spots in Charlotte.

But I never actually get a crepe here?..

The specials always look amazing, and we ALWAYS get whatever the mussels preparation is.

I haven't ever had a bad meal, or known someone who wasn't totally satisfied by coming here.

NOTE: Great spot to mix wine and appetizers if you're in the mood to pick at lots of different things!

Excellent food!  The spinach and mushroom crepe was excellent!  The cole slaw was sweet and extremely good and the French onion soup was some of the best I've ever had. Great environment, friendly service, and very clean restaurant. The mixed drinks are very good as well. The blackberry basil fizz is great (you can taste the basil in it). Definitely coming back to this place. Keep up the great work!

I just randomly decided to stop here as I was walking through NoDa with a friend and I gotta say, I thoroughly enjoyed it. It was fairly late, but we were still greeted with a welcoming smile and the waitress sat us and was probably one of the sweetest girls I've ever met.

We had the pesto fries which were super tasty. I had the Ham Gruyere crepe and I have to say, was delicious. My friend had "The Queen City" crepe and said it was awesome.

All in all, awesome service, we stayed a little past closing time and they were super gracious to us. Thanks for the good time!

The restaurant was very nicely decorated inside and super clean. Definitely a cool place to check out.

Yesterday 4 of my friends went to this place. Just 2 of us drank a coffee and ate a crepe and we got sick a few hours later. Really bad food poisoning that lasted several hours.

I usually don't write reviews but I think this is something people should know.
Its great and cute for quirky dates  just make sure u come at a reasonable time, gets quite busy

We've tried to eat here 3 times and every time the utter rudeness of the hostess staff has driven us out. Tonight we were actually seated and then UN-seated. She said she made a mistake! If you seat me, that is your fault not mine, but you DON'T aske me to get up once I have been seated. So we had a wonderful dinner at Boudreauxs down the street where we were actually welcome!

These hostesses learn their behavior from their superiors - management.
Not the best crepes but the sides were freaking fantastic. I would definitely order from them again.

Since I'm review #193, I'll keep it short-ish. We ventured in on a Friday evening; I'd always pictured more of a bakery inside, but it was the cutest, quaintest restaurant with candles lining the window, cozy lighting, and a comfy bar, which is where we sat.

We started with the Brussels sprouts - the whole reason we went - and they were divine. For dinner, the fella got the fish and chips, which were way too big for the plate they came on! He said it was pretty tasty. I got the ham and Gruyere cheese crepe, which had a sweet maple drizzle on top... yum. Then we had to get the nutella and banana crepe. The fella got one bite, which I thought was very generous of me. 

I'm not always a crepe fan since they usually seem too heavy or too light, but Crepe Cellar is just right. I hate that it took us this long to get there, and now I can't wait to go again!

I had really high hopes for this place. On a day trip to Charlotte, my sister, my boyfriend, and I stopped by for Sunday brunch. My sister and I had just come back from our trip to Paris, and we were really craving some crepes after having authentic ones from France. The result? Utter disappointment.

Don't get me wrong, the dishes other than the crepes seem to be pretty good. We all ordered the Pesto Brie French Fries to share as an appetizer. Though I thought it to be way too oily (both form the pesto and the double-fry on the potato), the flavor of the pesto mixed with the cheese was really spot on. My sister and boyfriend both ordered non-crepe dishes, and they enjoyed their brunch experience much more than I did. My sister ordered the Kahlua Batter French Toast, and she loved it. The toast itself had a really great amount of moistness without being too soggy. I didn't taste much of the kahlua flavor when I tried the toast, but it was still a pretty good french toast. The side sausage was too spicy and too dry for her taste, but the homefries were really crispy - probably because they are fried - and were quite flavorful. My boyfriend ordered the Eggs Florentine, and it was tasty as well. The french baguette was crispy, and the egg was perfectly poached. He did say that the smoked salmon underneath the egg cooked a little too much and became too dry. Otherwise, a pretty solid dish.

My experience, on the other hand, was far from ideal. I had the Smoked Salmon Breakfast Crepe, and it just didn't remind me of a crepe at all but more like a breakfast burrito. I clearly asked the waitress to remove the caramelized shallots from my dish, and when I actually dug into my crepe, there were SO MANY shallots. That wasn't my main complaint though. Smoked salmon just shouldn't be cooked in my opinion, and the salmon in my crepe was cooked way too much - became way too dry and lost all the appeal of smoked salmon to begin with. In addition, I thought the eggs in my crepe were really... runny and soggy for some reason, and not in a good way, since they were supposed to be scrambled. The crepe itself had specks of black dots along it (buckwheat maybe?), but it was much too thick and didn't have the flavorful appeal of the better crepes that I've had. I couldn't even finish a fourth of my crepe since it was just too unappetizing. Another huge problem came with the side of grits that I ordered - it was definitely microwaved. There was a layer of film all along the top and the sides of my grits that makes it obvious when something of that consistency is microwaved. Such a disappointment.

This review is purely based on my personal experiences with Crepe Cellar even though I do acknowledge that the other people I came with had much better experiences. I just don't think I can overlook the horribly made crepe and the microwaved grits. If you are to come here, trust me and stay away from the savory crepes.

I think this place gives you a lot of what the neighborhood is about. (I can say that as a local) Friendly, down to earth staff, great food, intimate feel and decor. Great for dates and introducing people to Charlotte! Food is awesome! I went their the other night and had the Chicken Black and Blue sandwich... That was a whole nother level of yumminess! And the dessert crepes are just freaking phenomenal! These people know what they're doin! It's small though, so keep the kids at home. And parking can be an issue on a busy night in the neighborhood. But I think its worth the hassle! Definitely a recommended spot! :)

It took us forever to find a restaurant with under an hour wait on a Saturday night.  Crepe Cellar was a good 20 minute wait (thank you!).  I decided to get the special crepe of the day (With spinach, smoked salmon, asparagus) because we were in CREPE Cellar.  The crepe is gluten free and tasted a bit weird to me.  The smoked salmon was really salty.  Overall, not a great meal.  I now wish I ordered their entree instead because they looked interesting.
Cute place in NoDa, Food was great just a little pricey. I had the grits which tasted perfect! The Brie fries was also good just a little bit oily! But otherwise than that everything was great.
If you are looking for a great date spot! Hit up Crepe Cellar even if you are just going for French Pressed Coffee and Brownie in a Blanket. You won't be disappointed both are delicious!

Best meal I've had in a long time. Left feeling too full to move! Had the pesto brie fries as an appetizer and the savory spinach, mushroom, and goat cheese crepe as well. For dessert I definitely recommend grabbing the seasonal pumpkin pie crepe before it's gone!

In our ongoing search for the best burger in town, I am happy to report that we have another candidate from a MOST unexpected source!  So the story goes:  

A few Sundays ago we were getting ready for the week and musing about how good it would be to have a great burger before the work week started.  I texted a good Friend an asked for something in our neighborhood as I didn't feel like driving across town.  my inquiry for the best burger close to the "hood" (we live in Midwood) was to go to the Crepe Cellar in NoDa!  I thought she had misread my text for a moment but she followed up with details before I could ask about how I also needed to have the fries topped with brie and pesto.  A little bit shocked (and wondering how much champagne said friend had intaken that day) we pile din the car and off we went.  Now I have been to the CC for brunch on multiple occasions and found it to be divine... but to think that a crepe joint might have the best burger was still not computing.  We actually found a parking spot out front and were greeted and seated by he pleasant staff in a matter of minutes.

As a brunch patron I never realized that what was on the rest of the menu and I sure didn't have a clue that they had a great beer list!!!  We ordered a really great Scottish IPA (a SIPA? LOL) on draught and the fried brussel sprouts for an app... happily both were amazing!!!  I kept saying I was done with the brussel sprouts and kept going back in for more.  While gorging ourselves on said brussel sprouts we ordered our burgers and when they arrived and we cut them in half you could immediately tell that this place was not playing around!!!  The meat was beautiful and cooked perfectly on the rare side of medium rare.  The fries (as mentioned earlier with the Brie and pesto) also were crazy good... and may be contenders for the best fries in the city as well!!!  All in all we were pleasantly shocked to death and will make the trip back many times in the future to enjoy these crazy good delicacies again!!!
Great spot for date night without having to break the bank. The Queen City crepe and the oysters were good. You can't go wrong with Pesto Brie fries!

I was in town for business and decided to have dinner at a different spot but wanted to try out the sweet crepes here for dessert. I stopped in to get a togo order and it took less than 10 minutes. I ordered the Bananas Foster crepe and it was delicious! 

The restaurant looked a little empty but it was after 9pm on a Tuesday so I didn't want to judge it by that.

Easily the best food in NoDa- maybe the best in CLT. I had the ginger loves Serrano cocktail- which was a fresher, tastier margarita- it was a bit overpriced, but was a good drink. Pesto Brie fries are great - a really unique combination of flavored.  The brussel sprouts are amazing- great texture. The short ribs were fork tender with a delicious sauce and pillow soft gnocchi. BF had fish & chips- flaky and high quality. We split the brownie crepe- so rich and delicious! The absolute best part was the service - Catherine did a great job and was a lot of fun. Their team approach to service ensured efficiency, and every server was just as warm and friendly as Catherine. Can't wait to see the expanded dining area!

It is hard to describe but I feel so not in Charlotte when I go to Crepe Cellar.  I think it is the gorgeous counter and the exposed beams, just the feel of the place is more NYC.  Have been here many times but here recently with a friend and I realized I have never reviewed it!!

The sangria here is fantastic.... a summer must.  My favorite item on the menu has to be the Pesto Chicken pizza.  It has sun-dried tomatoes, pesto, tender chicken on a crisp crust.  Perfect to share!  I have had a few of the crepes (Queen City and the Ham & Gruyere) which were good.  I definitely prefered the flavors of the Queen City and who can go wrong with a crepe that has bacon???  I look forward to coming back again and again since it is so close to Uptown.  Overall very consistent food and service!  Love it!  :-D

We were very excited to go back here for dinner due tonour last experience being so good.  We went with another couple who also love this restaurant. It has been a long time since any of us visited here.  We all wanted the mussels ofcourse cause they r known for those as well as the crepes.  We ordered apps meat and cheeses whch were good. Then here is where it begins.  We order the mussels "sorry we ran out" ohhhhhhK we will take the pork belly "sorry we ran out" fine. We both ordered the crepes, 1 mushroom and 1 ham and a side of brussel sprouts.  Then i order a glass of wine.  Sorry, "we ran out"   OMG.  Waited forever for drinks, service was average at best.  Ok here comes our crepes which were overcooked and then "sorry we ran out of brussel sprouts" This is insane, the whole experience and quality of food and service was just bad.

First time in NODA in years and years. Was anxious to see the development and new stuff going on up there.   The Crepe Cellar is not new; it has been around for about ten years. I don't think I had eaten there before, so Janet, my cousin-in-law,  and I decided to travel some distance to check it out. The place was fabulous.  Outstanding food. Outstanding ambiance. Outstanding service. Everything was in perfect order and I loved it, until the bill arrived. We both had the Crepe du Jour, which had chicken and beans and other fresh ingredients that made our taste buds dance.  The price of this special was not on the blackboard, so I assumed it was in line with the other prices on the menu.  Turns out, each crepe was $16.  Now, let me remind you, this was NOT a fresh catch of the day.  This was a C R E P E.  I don't blame them for not putting the price on the board!   I had a side of Brussel sprouts and misunderstood that a side was NOT included with the meal. The Brussel Sprouts, however, were amazing and worth the miles to get to this restaurant.  And the iced tea, which was the best I've had in ages, was fresh and so tasty, but $3.00 a glass was simply too much. I probably wouldn't gripe about $2.00 a glass.  In conclusion, a $50 lunch was NOT what I had in mind for the two of us.  Clearly, it was overpriced, even if the food was terrific.  Even if the atmosphere was terrific.   Oh, it turns out the owner has four restaurants right there together in NODA.   Obviously he has a great thing going and with his special crepes going for $16, he must be amongst the very rich and famous in the Queen City.   Go check out this restaurant, but take your fat wallet with you!
I think the Shrimp & Grits is the best thing on the menu! Nice small cozy restaurant...great for a date ;)

This was the last restaurant my boyfriend and I went to during our visit in Charlotte. We ended on a very good note. The atmosphere is beautiful, great for a first date, anniversary or just a girls night out. The exposed brick with the menu board was very informative. The tea light made it romantic. We started with the burrata which is made in house and it was delicious. I got the burger which was amazing, the garlic aioli made the burger. My boyfriend got the chicken crepe which was also very tasty. So dessert we got banana, strawberry and Nutella. Perfect way to end the meal.

Have been before and have always been pleased with the food and service. This being said, my last visit my entire order was incorrect. However, the bartender not only corrected everything but never once made me or my friend feel out of place or uncomfortable. By far, great food and great service. Will absolutely return.

Situated in Noda (Charlotte's equivalent of Philadelphia's South Street), Crepe Cellar strives to cater to the gastropub gourmand while offering a casual atmosphere and good drinking. 

I'll begin by saying that my overall experience (and that of my friends) was very enjoyable. The staff was friendly, the selection of alcohol was diverse and the food had its highs and lows. 

I applaud this restaurant's efforts in offering gourmet dishes in a pub scene. It is rare to see many pubs around here moving away from the stereotypical american bar. Example: Beef Short Rib over Potato Herb Gnocchi with roasted tomatoes, shallots, and cabernet reduction. Sounds delicious, and it was! But there are other items that attempt to push the envelope and miss completely. The pan seared duck breast not only had a "gamey" taste, but the "Korean BBQ Sauce" that was drizzled over it had no resemblance to anything from that country (neither the North nor the South). In fact, the taste was so familiar to me that I pinpointed it directly to the sweet chili sauce that you dip your Chinese take-out spring rolls in. And for the $22 this place is demanding for such a dish, I was sorely disappointed. As for the steak and frites, the meat was cooked nice and pink and the red wine sauce had a deep and velvety richness to it. The fries are good for mopping up the leftover sauce.

I think if you're making a trip all the way out here though, you should just stick to the crepes because the dessert that followed was perfection. We decided to split three different crepes to experience a variety of flavors and the choice was well made. We chose the mascarpone with berries, the crepe suzette (grand marnier, delicious), and the banana nutella. Everyone knows that the filling is a big deal, but it becomes irrelevant if the the crepe that holds it is structurally unsound, overly doughy, or rough and grainy. Crepe Cellar lives up to its name. The crepes were perfect. They were smooth, light, golden, and salted just enough to bring out the flavors they were showcasing. Of all the three, the Crepe Suzette was by far the best. It had a little "pool" of Grand Marnier underneath, which I imagine was flambeed, and a small ball of vanilla ice cream was placed on top. The combination was a deliciously sweet, creamy, alcoholy flavor that one could probably keep eating non-stop. 

I would definitely come back here to try the savory crepes and I would encourage others to do the same. Don't expect an intimate date though, it can get quite loud in the evening!

4/5

My dearest corned beef hash,

After so long searching in this metropolis, I have found you. I have suffered through the costly, fake, canned wannabes: the ones that were honest about their slop worthy version of your coveted, worthwhile, savory goodness. I can say it was worth it. You were worth it.

Your perfectly seasoned hand cut home fries make my mouth water. Your cooked to perfection hand carved corned beef make my eyes shine with tears of joy. And your caramelized onions, and roasted red peppers?! Love, I have found true love in the Queen City.

But you wish for the chase. Only appearing once a month. That is okay, I can be patient. For the day the hostess answers and tells me you will be there on that Sunday morning brunch, so shall I my sweet cherished corn beef hash. So shall I.

Until next time my love.

My first visit here and I must say I'm impressed.  Not so much with the fact that seating can be hard to come by but the food.  The food was just great.  Twice fried fries for starters, I seriously couldn't stop eating them!  So good!  Then for the main meal my girlfriend and I split one of the flat bread pizzas and I promise you it was more than enough for the two of us.  Large amount and I'm a pretty big eater so that's saying something.  Service was courteous and we were immediatley greeted with a smile.  I love NoDa area places, don't know what it is, but the vibe is good 9 times out of 10.  Crepe Cellar is no exception to this :)

My husband and I are regulars at Crepe Cellar and Growler's. He recently ordered take-out and his credit card was over-charged by almost 50% more than he signed. He has called and left his name/number for the manager three (3!) times over four days and has not gotten a call back, let alone a refund. Given this recent experience, we will likely take a break from your establishments. We would appreciate a call back.

I think this place and I are going to be friends.  There was a delicious salad of greens, dates, pine nuts and toasted manchego cheese which made an excellent entree with chicken added, and was satisfying without leaving me unpleasantly stuffed.  Of course, i went and spoiled that virtuous feeling by ordering a crepe Suzette for dessert, but it was to die for, so it's not like I regret it or anything.

This was our "second chance" visit to the Crepe Cellar. Our first visit was underwhelming but we had high hopes this time.

Our server, Allison, was second to none! The burrata was good... But not a good as last time. All 3 of our entrees were disappointing.

I ordered the beef short rib with gnocchi. The red wine reduction was tasty. The short rib tasted as if it had been reheated from a previous day. The gnocchi were so tough that I initially thought they had substituted pan fried potatoes. The kitchen remade them and they were only slightly more tender. 

My husband ordered the carbonara and it looked great. But... The pasta was overdone and the dish just seemed pasty and flavorless. It needed salt... Atleast. 

Our friend order a scallop dish and his words were.. "Good concept but not tasty."

Overall the kitchen seems to lack balance.  If they would be more generous in the seasoning and find acidic balance there would have been a world of difference in our meal.

Had lunch here a little bit ago with my wife. We decided to eat here because we were under the impression they served gluten free crepes. After talking to the waitress, she made it clear that they make their GF crepes on the same pan as the regular crepes. So cross contamination is definitely a concern. 
 I ordered fish and chips which I thought was great. My wife order a steak which she felt was under cooked. So this review is sort of a push. Nothing spectacular or worth returning for.

This place is pretty bad.  Their food isn't great (not terrible but not worth an hour wait) and it seems poorly run.  I'm pretty sure our waitress forgot about our order...twice.  This place is not worth the wait or the price.  I had high hopes for Crepe Cellar too but unfortunately two chances is all they will get from me!
Great place!! Great food!! Great service!! I highly recommend it!! Very accesible and it didn't take long to serve the food !!

Amazing experience! Yolanda did an amazing job taking care of my girlfriend and I. The burrata appetizer was awesome. We also got the Spinach and mushroom Crêpe as well as the Ham and gruyere. I personally wasn't a fan of the Ham and gruyere, but Yolanda was more than willing to get get me the Crêpe I wanted. Was to full for desert, but will definitely be back! Would definitely recommend trying.
I do enjoy this place I always order the burger it's really good however I don't enjoy how long I have to wait for my food every time and I don't enjoy the soda selection at all

Not even surprised that this restaurant has close to 200 reviews and all are positive ratings. This tiny euro pub is one of the most pleasant restaurants I've discovered in a while. The atmosphere is romantic and dimly lighted located in the NODA district. Perfect for date nights or ladies night. The servers are always nice and they make sure you have a great dining experience. They serve more than just crepes too. You should definitely order a desert crepe otherwise you'll miss out!

Their brunch was nothing short of magical!  Our waitress Stacy was incredible, from positive energy to intelligent selections it made our meal memorable. The French toast was nirvana.  Make sure you try their homemade sausage, it was insane. And... Their coffee is brought to the table in a French press!!!!!  Perfection

The food here was just okay. Their french press coffee is amazingggg. Now on to there crepes. The crepe seems to be a little bit soggy, and well just isn't much of a filling in there. You can taste more of the crepe, rather than their filling on the inside. I got the Queen City Crepe, and well it just leaves a little bit of a disappointment. My date ordered the french toast, and it just tasted very plain. It probably could've used alittle more batter. I also ordered the Brownie a Blanket Sundae. The brownie was a bit dry, the nutelle was yummy. You can never go wrong with the nutella. I do have to say it was definitely packed in there but I guess it's the local NODA residents that are faithful. But I do think, there can definitely be some improvement. For brunch, I would say Pewter Rose or Pike's Soda Shop really hits the spot.
They have great crepes, friendly service, and great beer.

Decor - Dining room is Great, but with kitchen a bit too open and seeing the jars of Sysco stuff is not a great visual
Food - Okay to Great  The oyster app was fantastic!  Props for those.  
                                        If your whole name is based on crepes, well those things better knock your socks off---they didn't.  Bland and nothing really of note that would make me say I want to come back again for those.   Since people will inevitably get those on their first whirl there, they stand to lose future return customers and referrals.  I'd advise to work on those and quick.  The burger was so freakin' good, though.  Very savory and I would come back for that.  
Price - Good.

Crepe Cellar is truly one of my favorites. In the NODA area of Charlotte. This place will satisfy your taste buds and the bar is full of amazing cocktails and beers. Tonight was just a stop for dessert and a drink. Our server was friendly and quick to take care of us. I had the 1st Ammendment Watermelon beer and it had a nice light cider taste to it but still refreshing. But the dessert crepe tonight was Brownie in a blanket. I needed help to finish this off. A fresh made crepe with walnuts and stuffed with a delicious moist brownie topped with ice cream. One of the servers even recognized us from our first visit last Halloween and asked would we be back this Halloween. How cool was that? And yes we will

The pesto brie fries are to die for!  We have been here numerous times and each time the food has been perfect.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  We love the atmosphere and the wine choices.  It's a great place to snuggle up with your love and have a relaxing evening with delicious food and great wine!

Loved our meal here! We started with the mussels and the famed brie pesto fries, and we probably could have just kept going on those and been so happy. They were delicious! For dinner we had a mushroom spinach crepe, the burger, a salad with shrimp and the sausage baguette pizza. All were fantastic and our table was filled with comments like "Next time I am getting that!" and "I can't stop eating these fries!". Our waitress was great and prices were fair. We would definitely recommend and return.

The illusory 'working lunch' brought us here today not for crepes, but for burgers, which our hostess promised were the best in Charlotte. While work was hard to complete, enjoyment of delicious gourmet burgers and nutella-stuffed dessert crepes was easy.

Pros
-Burger - I consider myself fairly experience in this department (especially recently, with 4 in the last week alone) but this was delicious. A little unorthodox with gruyere, fried onions and pickles it was daring and perfectly cooked. As an out of towner, I ordered medium-rare in a medium-only town, but still got what I wanted.
-Crepe dessert - nutella, banana, soft fluffy dough. Easy win.
-Our waitress heroically cut the check into 6 separates and processed 5 cards.

Cons
-Uneven service. Entrees were brought out in two waves which left that awkward 5 minutes or so for those early recipients, during which the other 3 of us had to make the obligatory command to 'please eat,' even though everyone knows it's rude to eat in front of hungry people.
-Cold fries on the first wave of entrees also earns them a few demerits.

This is such a cool place! We didn't intend to end up here but when the place we initially went to told us their wait time was 1.5 to 2 hours we just started walking down the street. We happened upon this place and were able to be seated immediately. It's not a large place, the lighting was dark and the place had a industrial vibe to it. Our server was Alex and she was great! We ordered appetizers only and OMG! SO GOOD! We shared an order of mussels and the portion was huge!!! More than enough to share. We also ordered the presto Brie French fries - DELISH!!! For our cocktails we both had the Smokin Word - this drink had a lot of tasty layers. Kind of spicy, a tiny bit of sweetness...hard to describe but very good. We received a complimentary serving of the Blasted Brussel Sprouts - also very good!! This is a nice place for a date or just to hang out with friends. I'm definitely returning.

Now that the place has been open for a while, they must have improved a lot bc these other reviews do no justice. The food is great. Love the roasted chicken and pumpkin gnocchi. The burger is better than Big Daddy's. Service is great and personal. Great date spot.
Cool hangout in the NO DA district. Nice pub and food is good. If you never been. A must try.

Have been here 5 times - the food is very good.  Last night was a disappointment.  My folks in from out of town, took a party of 6.  Out of house wine, so we ordered another bottle of white wine for $28, it was served warm at tasting.  Server, took and "chilled" the open bottle and returned it still warm - remedy was a cup of ice.  No scotch at bar except for Japanese Scotch - Scotch is from Scotland, right?  They were out of one of the entree's too.  Just disappointing and no effort to make things "right" by the server.  I will go back, but not for a while.

You can't go wrong with NoDa; or better yet, a good restaurant in NoDa.  Crêpe Cellar is an awesome spot.  Their vegetarian crêpes are great as well as their cole slaw and truffle fries.  Not a big fan of their Brussels sprouts because they were a bit bitter when I've had them, but the drinks are great.  I've always found the staff great.  Looking forward to going back.

Great addition to NODA.  The menu is lovely...not just crepes!  I had the sweet potato gnocci which were pretty good.  (much more doughy than expected, and not hot enough, but good).  My favorite is the brie and pesto fries...Trashy and classy all together, I love it!  The service was friendly and quick, clientele hip and attractive, and the space was fun and well designed.  I am planning on many a late night of crepes and champagne...!
Crepes are great but a bit pricey for what you get.  The cheese fries are fab if you are with a group.  If you have room try the desserts.

PESTO. BRIE. FRIES. Trust me on this one -- a must-try to start off a fantastic meal at this cute, cozy spot in NoDa. The fries are crispy and thin and the pesto, cheese, and tomato topping is so unique and ridiculously dangerous. Totally worth the couple of extra calories... ;)

This is a great spot for a date or with a small group of friends. The exposed brick walls, large bar, and smaller, low-lit eating space gives the Crepe Cellar a very intimate feel. 

I tried the ham and gruyere crepe with a side of asparagus. The crepe was delightfully crispy and light and packed full of flavor with the cheese and meat. My asparagus was also worth the slight up-charge, especially due to the sundried tomato topping that capped off the side. Highly recommend.

French coffee press is Amazing. If you like coffee, you won't be disappointed. 

I got the spinach mushroom crepe which was flavorful. The goat cheese in it was a bit salty for my taste so I would probably replace it next time or try something else. Fries were delicious and crispy. 

But the coffee, omg the coffee. I would come here again just for that. Service was great (wasn't busy weekday lunch time). Desserts looked great but was too full so will be returning to try other things! 

Cute decor/light fixtures!

I went with some friends on a weekday. It wasn't crowded so we didn't have to wait. We were told that they do not do reservations. 

The staff is friendly and they do assist you if you need help deciding on what to order. 
We had the special, that was 3 creppes and our choice of salad or soup. 
The were good!!!
I will come back again and try something different. Everything looks delicious!

I absolutely loved my crepe for lunch (spinach and mushroom, goat cheese on the side) with a side salad.   My husband gave the burger two thumbs up as well.  They were playing Wilco and the Avetts (I'm always biased towards places that play music that I enjoy).  Our server was genuinely friendly and attentive. Great little place in funky NoDa!

Normally we never go out to the NODA area and I never ever though we would eat here because when you hear a name like the Crepe Cellar all you think you are going to be eating are crepes. well weren't we wrong. Yes, of course they have crepes. But they also are known for many other things. For example their CRÊPE CELLAR BURGER (which I will be getting next time. 

When we walked in, it was a dark little restaurant that really reminded me of a pub feel. We were sat immediately and had the best server, Alex. She was so lively and excited that it was our first time in to eat. It really made the experience more exciting for us. She was very knowledgeable and seemed to really enjoy working there. 

So... For an appetizer, we ordered the mussels, which was very surprising to me because normally we never order mussels. Actually, now that I think about it, I have never seen my man eat mussels. But we ordered them and it was so worth the risk because they were AMAZING! The mussels were cooked with bacon, caramelized onions, shallots,
apples, and cider cream. To me, I was like no this can't be a good combination... but again I was wrong! It was a perfect combination of sweet, tart, light, creamy, deliciousness. If you are to go and get them ask them for extra bread to dip in once you finish. Great sharing dish.

For our entrees, my man had the BEEF SHORT RIB OVER POTATO HERB GNOCCHI, which included roasted tomatoes, shallots, cabernet reduction along with the gnocchi and beef short rib. The Short rib was so tender. I had their PASTA CARBONARA, which was fresh pasta, egg yolk, pancetta, grilled asparagus, parmesan, and black pepper. I ate it as is and it was actually a very light dish. You can add chicken or salmon for some extra protein. Entrees were portioned perfectly, but I suggest getting an appetizer or dessert if you are very hungry.

We were so full that we couldn't get a crepe for dessert, so we have to do that next time. It is definitely worth the trip out to Noda for this place.

In the running for the best burger in Charlotte despite only offering one burger option. Highly recommended if you're a burger aficionado.

Atmosphere is excellent with a dark bar vibe with French flair. Not very big but plenty of large comfy booths along the windows. Several tables as well.

Service has usually been good although can be a little slow when busy.

Consistency of food is usually quite good from visit to visit.

Parking sucks and is limited to the street. Expect a short walk at best unless you get lucky and nab a spot in front of the restaurant.

Awesome food, awesome service. Came with a friend and we tried a little bit of everything. Nothing was a disappointment. Sit at the bar with Alex, she's probably the sweetest bartender/server I've ever had

This place makes me want to find other cellars in the area that specialize in something!  I've always wanted to try this place, but haven't gotten a chance to until this weekend.  The original plan was to hit up Cabo Fish Taco, but their wait was about an hour and it was starting to sprinkle a bit.  

The Crepe Cellar, also had a wait, but we were able to scrounge some space at the bar to booze it up before dinner.  We tried the Pesto Brie Fries (which were AWESOME) and I landed on the Spinach and Wild Mushroom Crepe.  The side I got was the purple slaw.... nothing to write home about, but unique and different.  I like how it was light and not doused with mayo like some slaws tend to be.  Was trying to save room for dessert, but I was stuffed.  I'll definitely have to come back to try a regular entree and dessert!

Overall our waiter was great and attentive (even for a busy night).  The atmosphere was very cool - I really liked how the specials were written on a mirror on the wall large enough to see from anywhere in the room.  I'm not a big fan of dark restaurants since I like to "eat with my eyes" first, but this was just to the point where dim was becoming too dark (a good balance!).
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!! I have eaten there 3 times and love it.  Can't wait to go back.  All the crepes are awesome.  The 4 Cheese is to die for. Oh and the Crepe Suzette is amazing!!

Ok I am disappointed, tonight was not a very nice experience at Crepe Cellar. I've had better experiences. The waitress was indifferent, I asked her for recommendation but she acted like she was ready to leave. We didn't even go that late, it was 8:30PM. My Sangria was TERRIBLE, i want my $7 back! The Banana and nutella crepe was too sweet, this is the second time I had it and it is still not right. If you are going to call yourself crepe cellar, at least make your crepes takes good. If you want GREAT crepes, Try Hazelnut creperie, you won't be disappointed! The flavors are much more on par and the chefs are more committed. That being said, I do like the atmosphere at Crepe cellar, dark lighting, busy crowd and it is very loungey feel. I think they serve better salted food, like pesto fries and such. Just don't get anything sweet here, whenever I get sweets here, it ends up disappointing. My Crepe was OK, like acceptable, but my drink was TERRIBLE. Oh well, still a nice little place in Noda.

I came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised with a great lunch special. Albeit a short lunch special menu, i grabbed the Queen City Crepe for $8 and $1 for a side and $1 for a drink. a $10 lunch isn't bad compared to paying around $15+ without the special. Besides prices, the food and presentation was great. The fries are awesome.....what else. OH! duh, like the name, when you walk in, it looks like you're inside of a cellar! Not a huge venue, but the size along with the bar makes the atmosphere seem....cozy in a way. I MUST come back to try dessert. Happy eating!

Stopped in here before an Evening Muse concert on 6/21/2013.  Grabbed some counter space, had some ciders and a quick dinner, and it was pretty impressive!  The food is creative and outside the norm, which can make for an interesting meal.  I feel silly for not having tried this before!

Cabo Fish Taco is still a great choice, but consider giving the Crepe Cellar a try before your next concert in NoDa.

Great relaxed downtempo atmosphere.  Hip and classy while casual and unpretentious.  Impressive selection of beers, but nothing local.

"Blasted brussels sprouts w/ arrugula pesto" sounds great, but were too bitter, hard, and oily.

"Pesto brie french fries" were fabulous, but needs more pesto and Brie (and less oil) for a plate of fries that huge.  This is NOT a small side plate.

so this seems to be a popular place in charlotte, but i was a bit underwhelmed by my whole experience here.

first off, we were the only ones in the restaurant on a weekday night. no one else showed up for a half hour, and it seemed that the waitress had better things to do than check up on us in a more timely manner. she wasn't mean or rude, but she almost seemed uninterested in serving us by how she approached and left our table. maybe i was reading too much into it, but i found it odd. perhaps, she was just trying to give us our space and not "smother" us. i don't know. she really could have talked up the menu or been more into asking us what we needed/wanted.

my husband and i shared the house salad, the fish and chips and the infamous bananas foster crepe for dessert. house salad tasted good, but the dressing was overpoweringly garlicky. i could only eat half of it, because it was so strong. normally, i would have eaten it all myself--because, c'mon. it's just salad. the fish was actually perfect. nice crispy breading with a tender, moist fish in the middle. not too much batter, and no fish taste. just fresh and delicious. the tartar sauce was good, but not amazing. and the fries were a little too salty. they were cooked well. just too much sodium chloride.

and then--AND THEN--the bananas foster crepe. everyone here has raved about this crepe, so i decided we should try it. umm...maybe we went to the restaurant when everyone that worked there was having an off-day, but i thought it was totally boring. i was expecting something amazing, and i couldn't have been more sleepy about it. i've had better crepes at a friend's house, who had only learned to make crepes the same day we went over. it wasn't gross or anything. i guess there was just so much hype for me that i thought there would be more to it. 

sorry crepe cellar. while i'm glad i went to experience it, i don't know that i will go back. first impressions sort of mean a lot to me. and, i don't want to fall asleep at the table.

Such a cute atmosphere and great service! I was upset cause one of the drinks I wanted wasn't available but the super friendly bartender recommended another and it was delicious! They have a great liquor selection as well as beer and wine. My boyfriend and I just came here to get a dessert crepe, we got the mascarpone and berries crepe and it was delicious! I've been wanting to try this place for a while so it was very hard to chose which one as they all sounded amazing! I can't wait to come back for dinner and try one of their dinner crepes! If you aren't a crepe person they have plenty of other normal food on the menu as well!

When in NoDa and you have a hankering for a dinner or dessert crêpe, you know where to go.

They host a variety of crepes and sandwiches on their menu. The facility reminds me of a dim light Belgian restaurant but right in Charlotte! 

If you're a fan of craft beer, bourbon, and whisky, you will enjoy the vast selection of options that they regularly offer on the menu.

The service at Crêpe Cellar has always been top. Friendly, helpful, and relatively fast. The one downside is the ventilation from the kitchen. You will come out of there with kitchen smell on your clothing.

Pretty big fan of this place - been there a few times and they have great fries, awesome crepes, and general yummy-ness. The desserts look awesome (though I'm always too full), and the staff is very friendly about making substitutions.  Only thing that is a bit bothersome is that it gets really-really loud in there if the restaurant is full and the bar is crowded --- feels like there are a lot more people in there than there really are, plus with music playing it's a bit overwhelming.
Grits...great. French Toast...fantastic. Customer Service...charming and memorable. I can't wait to come back!
The most bare bones crepe that just comes dusted with some sugar, a little lemon, and a dollop of vanilla ice cream was DIVINE.  Eager to try more of their food.

I had a great lunch experience here! The waitress was on point, happy, and kind. 

We got the fries appetizer and it was extremely tasteful and delicious. I had the Queen Crepe for lunch, complimented with even more fries. The lunch was very tasty and I thoroughly enjoyed each bite, wishing it would never end. 

I left this Crepe place stuffed and happy. I recommend stopping in for a delicious brunch, lunch, dinner, post-dinner, whatever be your fancy! This place has a great Brooklyn/Noda vibe that fits the area very well.

This place is DELICIOUS. Went here last night for dessert after Cabo across the street. I agree with other people on here when they say they expect more dessert options. But, nonetheless, the banana fosters crepe never ceases to amaze me.
