Crepe Cellar has such an amazing ambiance. It's very calm and peaceful inside.. the candles on the table make it for a very romantic setting. The waitresses are always very friendly and helpful. 

I have yet to taste their dinner menu, but the options look incredible!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is interested.

In August I purchased a living social coupon for Crepe Cellar that cost $20 for $40 worth of food. My first attempt to try it out happened to be on a Monday, and when we arrived, we saw that they weren't open. Sadly, we had to dine elsewhere. But last weekend a friend and I decided at the last minute to check it out, and I was not disappointed. A breakdown of dinner:

1. Soup of the day - poblano sweet potato - very good but quite spicy. We didn't actually order any of this, but they said we could try if we wanted, so we did.
2. Chili shrimp appetizer - very good - solid amount of shrimp and a large baguette to dip in the chili sauce.
3. Salads - my friend and I both got a salad and were pleased with our choices. She ordered the Charcuterie salad with chicken and I got the Endive & Apple salad with grilled shrimp. The ginger maple dressing on my salad was phenomenal.
4. We split the brownie in a blanket dessert, which is actually that - a huge brownie wrapped in a crepe with a scoop of ice cream and a humongous scoop of whip cream. Really good thing we decided to split dessert because it would have been impossible to each eat our own.

We arrived around 5:30pm on a Saturday, so got a parking spot on the street and didn't have to wait. But the place quickly filled up (there's not a ton of seating), so I'd try to make reservations or not show up at peak times if you don't want to wait. It's a bit dark in there, but very cool vibe overall. And the service was good, although food was a bit pricey. Yay for living social coupons!
This is one of my little food fines in Charlotte love this place. I am sitting here now waiting for my burger. This Burger is so good and the staff is warm and inviting.

Located in the NoDa (North Davidson) district, this is a welcome addition to Charlotte's continuing culinary expansion.

I really enjoyed my lunch here, including both the savory and sweet crepes. The butter sugar crepe is simplicity at its best and the Nutella banana a serious chocolate-lover's indulgence. I would definitely like to come back here!

One of my favorite restaurants in NODA, pleasant and friendly service, the place is not big, there is probably about 8 small to medium size tables and there is a nice little bar where you can eat or enjoy a nice drink, they have specials and suggestions listed on a board at reasonable prices, I tried one of their red wine suggestions and fell I love with it.( I wish I could remember the name ;( but if I see the bottle I would recognize it right away) 
We waited about 45 min at the bar, which was about what the hostess had calculated, it was a Saturday night and we had no reservations, We could see the food brought around us looked and smelled delicious. 
Try the Brussels sprouts their steak and fries dinner was outstanding. 
Very pleasant experience all together, we will definitely be back.
Amazing brunch. Came in on a Sunday. Would definitely come back again. Loved the French press coffee! I had the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon and my other half had the French toast.

Loved the friendly service and the great food. Only problem I had was the music was too loud for understanding what the the waitress was saying and for talk at a normal volume. Would definitely recommend the chicken pesto baguette.

I have yet to eat something at the Crepe Cellar that I don't love. I love their breakfast crepes, lunch crepes and dessert crepes. YUM. 

In addition to the delicious food for which the restaurant is named, they also have a good selection of beer and wine and a full bar. 

The menu isn't extensive, but it's good. I highly recommend The Crepe Cellar for brunch, lunch or dinner. Good stuff.

Quick tip: **The Crepe Cellar has the best French Press I've ever had. Try it.**

Let me tell you about Pesto Brie Fries- delectable ! I would go here in the future simply to scarf those suckers down because they are a real treat. Seriously go for just those alone!

We also shared the sweet chili shrimp appetizer. My original thought was ew- just a tad too sweet- but the more I ate the better they tasted. While, I probably wouldn't get these again they weren't exactly bad either. 

We each had a glass of prosecco and a second of a house white- and the bill was moderately priced at about $50 (including tip) 

We skipped on dessert but I am hoping to check those out next time!

The venue is Intimate and cozy- and the service is friendly. All around its a great place for a date or just to catch up with a friend..Id
Great pesto Brie fries   Very very interesting menu.  Very ready to get to from ikea charlotte     What a find

This is by far my favorite place o eat in NODA. You can't go wrong. The crepes are excellent. Their daily specials are on point. I have never experienced a bad meal here and the service is excellent. I highly recommend it. The Buckwheat Crepes Ham and Guyere with a nice side of Roasted cauliflower maybe a pesto fry appetizer paired with a hard cider makes for a very enjoyable meal. Top it off with a brownie in a blanket and you will go beyond satisfied.
Fabulous. Best lunch in a long time. Fried manchego with arugula salad and fig dressing.

We strolled past the Crepe Cellar during a gallery crawl and figured we would have to come back by.  During a crawl the place is packed.  Really packed.  As in you almost can't get through the door.

Come by on another night - say a random Thursday - and they are just about empty.  So that could seriously change your opinion of the experience.

The vibe of the Cellar is odd.  It's a darkened room that can't quite seem to decide if they want to be a funky dessert place, a bar or a sports bar (tvs on the walls).  I really don't have any idea, even after going in and staying for a bit.  We just had a dessert crepe.

Service was spotty, but decent.  It took a while to get the glasses refilled, but the never really got to empty, so I can't complain too much.  The crepe itself was tasty but probably didn't justify the price.

This is in my hood and I love it. Their menu is fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is really great for a date or a pleasant dinner out. The Brie and pesto fries are a must. Their French onion soup is solid and they actually use Gruyere.. So bonus points. 

I'm not going to lie, but sometimes I just go there for dessert. Crepe+brownie+Nutella+ice cream+candied walnuts+ whipped cream and a cherry on top.

Finally got a chance to get back to CC. I came at lunch time with a friend and there was no wait at all around 12p. I had the baguette pizzas with pesto and chicken with a hard cider. Hit the spot. Meal and drink plus tax and tip was around $20.

Crepes do not taste like the crepes in France. They are not light and crispy like you find in Paris. They taste more like a burrito wrap- thick and gooey soft. Also one crepe that was ordered had a nasty mustard sauce on it. Yuck! Hubby loved his shrimp and grits that were $17 a plate for lunch! Fries were shoestring greasy fries like you get at the mall but served in a triangle serving cup.

This place was a home run. Great ambiance, not noisy at all and casual dining. The cocktail menu was detailed, descriptive and priced right. Even the restroom looked amazing. I'm a big fan of subway tiles and the restroom displayed them brilliantly. 

As soon as you walk in the restaurant, you're greeted by the hostess while passing the full service bar with top shelf liquor and a cooled featured wine fridge. Most of their menu is chalked on the board along side the seating area with their specials also chalked. 

Service is quick and on point. Our waitress Sara took our orders and quickly got us our cocktails, and appetizers. The drinks were great. A mix of all types of top shelf liquor spruced up with a sour, sweets and bitters. Our appetizer was steamed mussel with smokey bacon, jalapeños in a beer broth with fresh bread to soak up the flavors of the broth. 

Our entrées were nothing short of spectacular. Seared tuna on a bed of steamed kale with roasted garlic quinoa and a grilled tomato cream sauce. The fish and chips was a large portion of beer battered cod and hand cut fries served with ketchup, tarter and malt vinegar on the side. 

For dessert we had a Bananas Foster which is a warm crÊpe with bananas and whip cream. 

This place was perfect for us. Highly recommend it.

4th time at Crepe Cellars.  First 3 times were fabulous (would rate a five if it wasn't for most recent experience), couldn't wait to go back, 4th time, a little disappointed in some of the food and hostess was very rude.  When I put my name on the list I asked for an approximate wait time.  The hostess seemed very insulted that I asked, she said "I CANNOT predict how long the wait will be...there are three parties ahead of you."  We waited about one hour.  Sat at bar while we waited- the bartender is FABULOUS, he is very attentive and knows ALL about the wine selection (as a bartender should).  Our waitress was very attentive.  The Queen City crepes were very dry but had great flavor, the last time I had them they were MUCH better.  The ham and gruyere crepes were drenched in the béchamel sauce which made them seem almost like a breakfast or brunch item, too much sauce, too sweet, but also VERY good flavor.  The  succotash is AMAZING!  And the crepe suzette is to die for!!!  I was also a little disappointed that there was a table with about 6 screaming children next to us, not the fault of the restaurant...Very reasonable prices!

Went here for Sunday brunch.  Charming spot on the north side of Charlotte.  I went due to the Yelp reviews and wondered where the hell i was going during the drive up there thru strip mall hell and suburbia.  However, NoDa is this tiny little 2x2 blocks of stores and restaurants...almost what we hoped dilworth would be.

The food was awesome.  French press coffee.  Smoked salmon and egg crepes, pesto/brie french fries.  My heart is still aching but my stomach was lovin' me.

Stopping through Charlotte for the night on our way back to VA, my wife and I explore the NoDa neighborhood.  I had the Stone Brewing Oatmeal Chocolate stout, which is delicious.  We ordered one of the baguette pizza's, which was good but not earth shattering.  Enjoyed the ambiance, lighting, and setting.  Service was really quick and attentive.

Stopped in here late evening after a Noda hang on Saturday night.  Mac n cheese was really good.  
Good atmosphere, good service despite the later hour

You had me at buckwheat! 

I am a nut for buckwheat, and really anything that goes above and beyond flour. Flour is blah. Buckwheat is so nutritious and full of minerals and fiber, and let's not forget it's totally delicious! My friend ranted a raved a little about this place, setting it up with quite the lofty praise that "everything there is good". My jaded and suspicious heart (which has yet to get over the disappointment of the Blair Witch Project hype) immediately began looking for ways to prove her wrong. ...... Then I saw "buckwheat" on the menu. In fact all of the crepes are made with buckwheat. ..Squee!

I hemmed and hawed and landed on the turkey, apple, brie crepe and the slaw. I don't normally like slaw, but something (fate!?) led me to order it. And I beheld it. And I tasted it. And it was glorious. All of it. The crepe was delicious and just the right serving size. The slaw was a red (purple?) cabbage with just the right liquid mixture. i could eat that slaw every day. 

My companion had one of the sandwiches, but requested it on a crepe. They'll do that, because they're awesome. She also ordered the pesto fries. As far as I could tell, her meal was thoroughly enjoyed. The pesto fries had a great taste and are definitely a dish to share. They are, however, slightly too salty and soggy for me to say I love them. I can only recommend them and hope that the s&s concern is shared by others and will be fixed in the future.

Mixed drinks were good. Food was good. Buckwheat was delicious. Truly "everything there is good". I do have to warn you that the place is really loud. The sound carries very strangely in some of the old warehouse-ish buildings. I could hear the guy diagonal from me and 5 feet away better than I could hear my friend across from me. Expect a lot of shouting and for your conversation to be overheard by your neighbors.

Beyond the overly delicious bananas foster crepe, one of my favorite desserts in Charlotte, I've been super impressed with a few more items I've snacked on as of late...

Pesto Basil Fries: 3.5/5: I mean, comon', now. A pile of hot crispy frites smothered in melty brie, pesto and diced tomatoes. It's exactly what you think it would be. The 

Fig Salad 5/5: Holy cow, I'm crushing on this salad. Fresh, peppery arugula sprinkled with sweet figs, pine nuts, a light fig balsamic dressing and (my choice) of grilled shrimp. Oh, and don't you forget the fried manchego cubes on the side. NOM. 

I dig the environment, the cozy tables and the friendly service that encompasses the Crepe Cellar. Long live the crepe!
This is the place to go for crepes. Not a big menu. Mostly savory or sweet crepes. Very casual and affordable  small and cute. On street parking

Great food. Had brunch with a friend. Bloody mary was delicious.  I ordered the KB French toast and we share the pesto fries for an appetizer. Both were amazing. We should have shared a meal. Large portions.
Their sweet and savory crepe options were wonderful! My boyfriend and I split one of each and were very impressed.

The highs are really high and the lows are really disappointing at Crepe Cellar.  I haven't taken advantage of their range of beer and wine; this is probably bad, because judging by the urgency of the kitchen they're really hoping you'll take 20-30 minutes to drink something and not worry about how long your dishes will take to get to your table.

Pros: Very friendly waitstaff - every time I've been, each server was engaging and friendly. Specials creative enough to want to order.  The crepes themselves are excellent (as well as a good value), and the savory buckwheat crepes are surprisingly light.  The purple coleslaw, on its better days.  The desserts are great.

Cons: The kitchen is slow and underseasons each entree that I've had so far, including the beef stew, the crepe with spinach, goat cheese, shallots and chicken and a different crepe special.  This food can get bland.  

When to go: For an early dinner before the crowds start to arrive, or with a date in the evening to split a dessert.

I want to love this place, but it can't happen until the kitchen is as disciplined with the rest of its savory offerings as it is with the crepes.

Excellent pizza, not so crazy about the crepes (minus the dessert one with gnutella).  Hopping spot on the weekends, make sure you are not going on a gallery crawl night or be prepared for a 2+ hour wait.  Sadly no reservations.  Good beer list and service.

Crepe Cellar....First Review is now retracted ....  had a bit of bad luck my first visit and wrote a "not so nice" review.   Went back again and had a totally different experience.

Everything was perfect from the moment we walked in the door.  Granted it was busy on a late Tuesday night...but we managed to get right in and on a table somehow.   

Bartender did an excellent job on our cocktails.

Food was delicious and came out with perfect timing.

The salad was nice and fresh and not drowning in dressing.  The Fusilli pasta was an excellent choice.  It had lots of flavor without being heavy or overpowering.

The dessert (Chocolate Brownie Crepe) was probably THE best thing that hit the table.

Our server was a cutie and very nice.

Overall,  we had a great experience and now this may be one of my favorite new little spots to eat.

Glad I tried it again.....Check it out...you wont be disappointed.

My sister and I stumbled upon the crepe cellar on our mini food tour.  We shared a banana and nutella crepe, which was the most amazing and simple dish!  The bananas were the perfect consistency and the nutella was the perfect temperature.  The waitress was a bit slow, but she was very pleasant.  

Free street parking.

This is a super cute restaurant located in the NoDa area, specializing in delicious crepes of all varieties. The location is perfect since it is central to a lot of bars, cafes, ect. The atmosphere is perfect for a date night since it has a really romantic vibe. 

The crepes themselves are amazing! When I when here I had a dessert crepe with nutella in it! The crepe itself was warm and the nutella was oozing out of it. The entire thing was topped with whipped cream adding the finishing touch. If you are looking for something  more on the savory side they have different options to include ham, wild mushroom and spinach, plus more. 

If you are in the NoDa area I would give this place a try.

The crepe that I had was not seasoned very well( I had the goat cheese and chicken crepe) and they added only a bit of goat cheese. The food is not worth it to me for the price. The fries were amazing and the atmosphere was pretty good too.

First of all, order the pesto brie fries as an appetizer - they're a must! This may sound strange, but we go to the crepe cellar specifically for their burger. It is seriously one of the best burgers in Charlotte - rivaling those on the menus of specialty burger joints. The flavor of the beef paired with the gruyere cheese, onion straws, and garlic aioli is out of this world. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I ordered the mac and cheese as a side and it was outstanding. On top of this, the cocktails are great & service is wonderful. Highly recommend!

My friend's cousin took us to this place as she'd heard a lot about it. I never say no to crepes, so in we went. It was an interesting vibe, good concept, not too full in the late afternoon.
Friend and I thought we could take advantage of happy hour deals but we were promptly told by the waitress that there is NO happy hour in all of North Carolina. What a travesty! We almost didn't believe her and then learned, you Charlotte-ians have worked your way around that problem. You just call them "specials" and offer them all day long (and I'm not sure how exactly this all day special is supposed to prevent binge drinking...) Whatever, as long as I get my $1 off that beer. 

Onto the food - I only sampled the crepes the other two gals had. One was a sausage and peppers with shallots, and the sausage was delicious, but there wasn't enough stuffing, and I wasn't a fan of the buckwheat crepe, it just doesn't taste good on its own. With more stuffing and flavor, this crepe would have been delish. The other crepe was the wild mushroom and spinach with caramelized shallots and goat cheese, so I was expecting a lot of great flavors. But it too fell short, it needed more salt and seasoning, and more stuffing. 
The slaw was decent, I prefer this vinegar slaw to the regular slaw.

The beer was good, wish they had "specials" on the wine, and the service was ok, a little over-attentive, and then a little over-apologetic when we noted our "special" on the beer wasn't accounted for.

Pesto Brie fries are a must if you want an appetizer!  Both crepes we had were also amazing! 
Cute spot in NODA and great for a date night. Definitely recommend!

My boyfriend and I came here just the other day, it was great.  We had some steamed coffee (the kind with a timer) and crepe's! Was a fun place and not too expensive either. :)  Will definitely return in time.

Nice ambience, very friendly, polite and professional waitresses. The menu is limited, but you would go there for Crepes and they do a good job on that. They have limited space but its worth waiting in the neighbouring bar (the waitress comes and fetches you once a table is available!).  Overal I was really happy and will go again.

First, get the Pesto Brie Fries. They are unbelievably good. Out of this world good. I've come back just for them. 

The savory crepes are okay here. I have no complaints I just think I may not be a savory crepe kind of guy. I really enjoy the atmosphere of this place, it's kind of cozy and warm. Plus, the staff has always been nice here.

I love this restaurant! It's very small and cozy, but not at all overcrowded. The lighting is low and the atmosphere is laid-back so it's a great place to go with a group of friends or on a date. 

The food is delicious, I love the unique foods they use to fill the dinner crepes. I tend to order the turkey, apple and Brie which never disappoints. The dessert crepes are also fantastic, sweet and tummy but not so rich that you're left with a toothache after :-)

The service is always friendly and the food gets out to you rather quickly. I've only gone right after work, around 5:30pm, so I usually beat the real dinner rush around 6:30/7:00.
This place AMAZING! Such a cozy atmosphere, great food, and the cocktails here are to die for!

We finally ventured to Crepe Cellar after having passed by it numerous times.  While we didn't really like their signature dish (i.e., their crepes), we liked the other dishes enough to want to return and try something different. 

We started with the burrata, a delicious dish of homemade (?) mozzarella, grilled French bread, and a drizzle of honey and lemon.  If you have had the burrata at Dolce, we really think this one is better.  And, it's much less expensive!

For our entrees, I had the four cheese (with bacon) crepe, and my husband had the crepe special, with ham, Swiss, mushrooms, and tomatoes.  His was better than mine, but honestly, neither of us were fond of the grainy buckwheat crepes.  My mac and cheese side, however, was just fantastic.  

Service was really good and attentive on a busy Saturday evening.  And we both really liked the vibe of the place.  

We will come back, and we'll probably try either a burger or one of their entrees on our next visit.  But we'll most definitely get the burrata again.

I've now been here a couple of times.  They just expanded - so there is more room and less of a wait too!  I always love my meal, and often try the specials, but definitely have my favorites.  The brussel sprouts are out of this world.  I try all the time to mildly duplicate this recipe and just can't.  They are insane.  The burgers are great and I always try to split a couple of things so there is room for dessert.  You cannot come here without at least splitting a dessert crepe.  The people that work there are super sweet and try to accommodate however they can for special occasions and big groups.  Its especially awesome for dates or anniversaries and such - and there is a bar right next door (owned by the same people) that you can go afterwards too.

This is one of my absolute favorite places to eat! I've been here 3 or 4 times with friends, and all of us have hugely enjoyed our meals. The dessert crepes are to die for, and the beers are excellent. The tea was one of my favorite parts, and I was very happy with the selections. I took one friend there just because he would enjoy the tea, and we were not disappointed!
Even if I eat elsewhere in NoDa, I find myself at the Crepe Cellar for dessert and tea...

No didn't love it won't be back.  Pesto fries great idea with cheese so in actuality small handful of cheese melted on fries then large amount of pesto on top. Couldn't taste anything but pesto and fries cheese could not come through all that. Onion soup sweet really sweet lots onions bland bland base not rich enough or deep enough. Crepe turkey apple compote shaved deli turkey really filling small amount crepe still doughy.  Mac and cheese now that was awesome some little zing at the end amazing. A bit to cheesy for me but worth it. Fish and chips which is supposed to be Charlottes best was good not great. It gets a lot of it's oomph from its presentation the smaller side of the fish was good when you got to the thicker part was a little too bland or really bland and slightly mushy with a heavier fish fat content. I should say about the fish it's about 3.5 inches thick at one side tapers down to about two inches  tube shaped and maybe 5-6 inches long. It looks really cool and the way the batter comes off sorta makes it look like a fish. 3.50 for a piece of cold bread not cool. It was supposed to be warmed baguette. Drink menu great and wine menu nice. Service was good and she was pleasant kept up with water sodas and such.  It's like it's close got good enough but didn't go further. What about a bechamel sauce on side for fries to tamper pesto and give it better flavor. Better base for onion soup.

Our server was very nice, but not at all attentive. Myself and my lunch companion both ordered beer and waited for nearly 10 minutes while we watched her stock the bar rather than pouring our drinks. 

The food was good, but I feel like it was overpriced for the quality.

This is a cute little restaurant, very cozy and intimate inside.  The food is so good!  They have different specials all of the time and most are definitely worth trying.  The dessert crepes are to die for! 

The service is excellent. The staff has always been very welcoming and friendly every time that I've been there.  They are knowledgeable of the food and drinks and will offer up ideal selections!

I used to study abroad in Japan and the only kind of crepes I came across there was the dessert type, sweet street vendors selling icecream and strawberry filled snacks. But dont be expecting this place to only satisfy your dessert cravings, they are a bunch of show offs that declares to the world crepes can be real food too.

Crepes for breakfast, crepes for brunch, lunch, dinner and dessert they do get creative. I myself ordered their burger because crepes are forever a dessert food for me, but my so ordered one of the crepes as a brunch dish and it wasnt too bad. Itll take me a few trips to convert me tho.

The place was overall very clean and hip, maybe even too hip. Hipster central, guess thats why they charge like 10 dolars a crepe. But it was still good. Service was good, tho they never wrote down our orders and forgot a sausage on the so's crepe, which they corrected later. Should probably write down a customer's order on the spot, hipsters are smart but like 90% hot air.

Overall a very interesting experience that will change your preconceptions of crepes forever. Either you'll come to love crepes even more, or outright hate em from now on. Hopefully it's the former. For me Im not sure. Good luck my friends.

This is a great place in the Noda area. With Crepes being part of the name, I bet you can guess what might be featured on the menu! Yes, that's right.... Crepes. And they are good crepes too! Overall, I like this restaurant for its food, atmosphere, and wine selection. They do have much more than crepes to eat so do not worry if you are not a fan of the crepe. The menu is fairly extensive including burgers, salads, etc. One thing that I especially like is that they seem to try to draw from local sources for menu items - which I prefer. Although I met friends for dinner when I went, I could easily see this as a good date restaurant.

Best restaurant in NoDa! My husband and I frequent the Crepe Cellar a lot and always bring visitors from out of town here. We live the mussels, chicken sandwich and Brussels sprouts. Our friends have loved the Crepes although they our not our favorite on the menu. This place is always on point!

I went here for brunch after church w the BF. Really cute inside with a great atmostphere. The menu is very diverse, with all sorts of brunch items from standard egg/meat/carb plates, to crepes sweet and savory, and things like french toast and a really tasty looking burger. The sage honey butter biscuits were delicious!! I just wish the butter came on the side instead of pre-smeared on top.  I wanted more of it, and I wanted it on more than just the top layer of the biscuit! It was delicious though.  I had the sausage egg and cheese crepe.  It was ok, but didn't knock my socks off. It needed a little salsa or something to jazz it up, and I didn't like the gluten friendly crepe wrapper. The grits were really really good as a side dish though.  BF had the french toast which was amazing and the omelet of the day.  The omelet was made incorrectly initially and our server apologized and fixed it before even bringing it out, and comped it at the end of the meal because of the delay. I ogled the burgers at the table next to us, they looked amazing. There were many fancy beverage options, but we didn't imbibe. For a Sunday brunch the restaurant had good traffic and stayed busy but we were seated immediately. Not the best brunch I've ever had, but definitely solid and recommended.
The oysters and the burger were absolutely incredible. I wasn't a big fan of the sausage and egg crepe but then again it may be because I enjoyed the burger so much.

This is my second time going to Crepe Cellar and it didn't disappoint this time either. I had the French Toast breakfast with potatoes and bacon. Really good. Had to take the last two pieces home add the bread is so thick. Great atmosphere.

It's been years since I have been here. Crepes usually don't fill me up but the Apple, brie crepe was substantial and delious. Noce to know that this NODA staple is still rocking it for so long. If you haven't been, do yourself a favor and go.

First time here and I can't wait to come back. We came for sunday brunch. I ordered the ham and gruyere crepe which was AMAZING (and I lived in France for 6months). It came with a side of home fries (not really french but seasoned very well). You have to order the honey biscuit as a side. It's made with sage and honey and drizzled with honey and butter. Delicious!! We split one for desert (yup, it's that big) and had it with coffee. Note - if you order a cup of coffee you will get an entire French press (I.e., 3-4 glasses of coffee). 

Although they were very busy (Sunday brunch is the busiest) we were seated quickly and had great service!!

Been here for lunch a few times during the week. It was not busy during this time.  Had savory and sweet crepes and all of them were delicious. I especially love the french press coffee they serve.  It's from a local place and ground fresh.

I visited this location last night with a friend.  My reviews of the Crêpe Cellar certainly did not do it justice.  We decided to try several different small dishes (tapas style) and I'm so glad we did.  It was fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!  First, we ordered the pesto Brie fries and oysters.  The pesto Brie fries were just as amazing as the first time I had them.  I think the only thing I would mention about those is that there was a lot of oil from the pesto.  However, the fries were still good enough to lick the plate if needed.  The oysters were absolutely the best oysters my friend and I (combined) had ever tasted.  The oysters were cooked to perfection and just the right balance of flavors.  Then, we chose the Queen City crepe with a side of mac & cheese.  The chef took the time to split it into two plates for us to share.  Those little attention to details really make the experience more memorable.  Lastly, we had white bean bisque, which was very exquisite.  The flavors balanced well and just really tasted great.

If you come to Charlotte or NODA, I would suggest stopping by to have dinner.  The food and wait staff were amazing.  If you go anywhere else for dinner, you're missing out!

I would say our experience was pretty epic and we will be back soon!

The Crepe Cellar was amazing! The food, the drinks, the staff...everything was wonderful. Brunch for Mother's Day, as you can imagine, was very busy. Alex, our server (who was also managing the bar) never missed a beat. The pesto brie fries were great...full of flavor and nice texture. The smoked salmon breakfast crepe was delicious. And the limoncello craft cocktail was killer. You can taste the passion the chef has for his/her art. My friends and I can't wait to go back.

This is a new favorite lunch spot of mine in NoDa. Came here with a girlfriend of mine and got the Mushroom& Spinach Crêpe, added chicken, and subbed the fries with a house salad. Great flavor and light yet filling lunch. Took away one star because it wasn't very warm when served. The server reheated it and didn't charge me for adding chicken on the bill, which was nice.

I have tried the Pesto Brie Fries and they certainly are "devour able" num. Mint-green tea is a staple for me, along with the strawberry banana Nutella crepe.  The Pesto pasta is meh, I ordered the thing once and never again, also had the pizza there not my favorite. Thank goodness the desserts, service, and atmosphere makes everything Good!

One of the first places I dined at in Charlotte. I loved it. Everything from the service, to the food. and the ambiance was great. I recall having the special of the day, which was Salmon, and I remember quite liking it :)
Even though it was a week night, the restaurant was busy (and I've noticed that, that seems to be the case with most good restaurants in the city! Whether weekday or weekend, if the weather i good, people are out and about!). Crepe Cellar is one of those quieter, dimly lit places, that allows you to sit and have a good conversation over some tasty food and good wine.

I've been to Crepe Cellar a handful of times. It isn't one of my go-to places mostly because it is very small, often crowded, and loud inside. Everything I've had here has been pretty good, but I'm not a huge fan of crepes so I normally go for something else. Their pesto brie fries are awesome and the brussels sprouts are the best I've had anywhere. The sprouts are roasted and then topped with arugula pesto and parmesan--yum yum! My husband and I split the fries and sprouts as our meal and still had leftovers. 
They usually have specials that sound delicious. Prices are all over the map so you can go and spent $10 or you can spend $25 on a special entree. They have a small but decent beer selection and a good wine selection.

Overall, great food and great atmosphere!  The minute I drove by and saw the word crepe, I had been dying to go, so I finally dragged my boyfriend.  I wasn't expecting him to enjoy it since he's more of a "meat and potatoes" kind of guy.  He ended up fending well for himself with their tuna seafood special which was to die for.  I on the other hand, stuck with the crepes.  The ham and gruyere crepe was everything I expected and hit the spot.   Just understand that you are getting exactly what you ordered, ham and cheese so don't set your expectations too high. 

 For being a busy night, we got our food remarkably fast.  The desserts are where it is at when you come here.  We both got the nutella crepes and they were by far our favorite part.  The fruit was fresh and ripe and was a perfect end to a good meal.  

My only warning, this place is very small, only 12 or so tables and a small bar, so be aware that if you go during peak hours, you are going to have a pretty good wait.

This was and I stress "was" one of my favorite places to eat.  Because we had tickets to an event, my friend attempted to make reservations and was told that reservations were not accepted, but if we arrived by 6:00, there should be no problem with seating.  Were we ever wrong!  The place was packed, and I guess I should be glad for the restaurant.  We thought about going some place less crowded, but we were told we would be seated in 15 minutes.  Now.  I don't care if you are the owner, busboy, hostess.....whatever.  Don't say "15 minutes" if you can't deliver.  We waited close to an hour before we had a table.  I ordered the spinach and mushroom crepe.  I have enjoyed this entree in the past.....creamy, delicious and vegetarian.  As I was eating, I bit down into something absolutely repulsive and discovered it was chicken.  Because we were pressed for time, I simply removed the poultry from the dish.  What was left was a smidge of spinach and very few mushrooms, no cheese or sauce to speak of.  Thank goodness for the smattering of fries, or I would have left hungry.  I am typically laid back, but this experience was definitely a gastronomic horror film.

The food was decent. I loved the pesto brie fries! It is a must get appetizer, you will regret it if you don't order this! 

The first time I went there, I got the special crepe with salmon. It was delicious. However, the second time, I ordered the pesto pasta and it was surprisingly disappointing. There was not enough flavor, very bland. I'm not sure if it was an off day or what, but I was sad considering the awesome experience I had the first time. 

My friend ordered the beef short rib over potato herb gnocci and that was really good! So I would recommend trying that. The beef was so tender and the gnocci was perfectly cooked with such a great sauce! 

The atmosphere is good too. It's quite small, but can be very intimate and private. Not a bad place to go on a date!

Had brunch with our 3 kids on Sunday. First time and were very impressed. All 5 entrées were tasty and original. Fresh ingredients and excellent service. Fries were fantastic along with the desert crepe we shared as our final dish. Looking forward to doing a dinner with wife for a fun night out.  No complaints so highly recommend! Pics of our dishes attached.

i do like the appetizers there. Hubby had a crepe (savory) and I didn't care for it. I will speak for my food: I ordered shrimp and grits which is amazing and shrimps were juicy and delicious. Also, we had desserts crepe and asked for a scoop of ice cream on the side. I had a good meal there. Be aware that the charge on your credit card will be from the  Growlers pourhouse ( i had to google ) since we did not eat there (apparently same owners?). Would go back.

Last night I finally made it to the place, the beer I ordered(only IPA in the place) They ran out of . The service was skimpy, the server never read us the specials. What we did get was ok, spinach and mushroom crepes plus chicken and a club. The mushrooms tasted canned and it was not very hot. There are wines by the glass or bottle, same for beer and full bar service.

This place was surprisingly good so that may be why I am giving it 4 stars.  I think my expectations were pretty low so I came out on top in this case!  It was one of the only places not taking reservations for NYE so we ended up eating here with a group of 6.

They had a seared tuna over sweet potatoes special that night and a sausage and peppers crepe.  Everyone in our party was very satisfied with their meals.  At our table we ordered a couple of the tuna meals, the sausage and peppers crepe, the queen city crepe, the pasta dish and I ordered the endive and apple salad....I know, seems to be a little boring but this was one of the best I have ever had.  I think it was their ginger maple dressing..a must try!!!  

Everything had a lot of flavor and seemed pretty fresh.  Those who had fries on the side were especially happy because they were seasoned curly fries.  Very scrumptious!

Then came the dessert....I was hoping that we could all try something different but the waitress steared us all to the brownie in a blanket.  It was exactly what it sounds like...a big warm brownie wrapped up in a crepe, topped with vanilla bean ice cream, whipped cream and candied walnuts.  It was a very rich brownie and it was also covered with nutella so it was super filling.  We really could have ordered one with 6 people and we would have been fine.  The vanilla bean ice cream was a little...well...bland.  It had  potential to really join forces with the brownie and make a perfect bite, but for some reason it just didn't flow that well in my opinion.  It didn't add anything to the overall flavor as I was hoping it would.  And, quite honestly, the crepe didn't add much to the whole package either.  It was just not quite working for me.  I think you have to be still semi-hungry and an absolute chocolate lover to enjoy this dessert.  It was good but it could have been a little better in my opinion!  I am dying to try the bananas foster crepe.  I will definitely return.

The negatives:  Not very many vegetarian or vegan options.
The scene:  Great for groups, not a romantic setting even thought it is dim in the restaurant.
Location:  It is centrally located in the fun noda area so it is a great place to grab a quick, affordable fun dinner AND dessert before heading to your next spot!

Definitely worth checking out!

I'd like to give Crepe Cellar more stars, but every experience I've had here rounds out to really just OK. Some nights it's really spotty service and a delicious meal, others it's spectacular service and a lackluster meal. Last night was pretty much the same story. 

We ordered the cellar plate (meats & cheeses) and it was dropped off without any description. We figured most of it out on our own, but the whole time we were enjoying it I couldn't get the server's attention to give us a rundown. We didn't get checked in on until our entrees were brought to the table, and when we finally go to ask about a certain cheese, we couldn't even be given a straight answer. How do you not know what the chefs are plating up? 

Our entrees were fairly good. The flavors of the duck dish were great even though parts of the protein were a little tough (the middle was seared beautifully). The Queen City Crepe was delicious, and with a side a fries very filling (though yes, a good portion of them were as mike k described "crumb fries").  

Will I find myself eating at crepe cellar again? Most likely. They offer a menu selection somewhat rare for NoDa, and you can't pass up their great beer options. (Plus, I have a feeling CC has the potential for a five star evening it in somewhere...) Also, on busier nights I love that I can put my name in and then mosey on over to growlers for a drink or two until my table is ready.

We came on a Sunday night, and there was a fair number of tables occupied.  The brussel sprout appetizer was excellent.  I had the steak and fries, which was cooked just right.  

The nutella and banana crepe was good, but it was a little cold.  It was a good experience none the less.

Hmmmm...we had such high hopes!  

We went there for a Saturday lunch today.  When we walked in the place was full, but we only had to wait about 2 minutes for a table to open up.  Nearly perfect timing!  It was a beautiful day, so NoDA was packed with pedestrians, and we considered ourselves fortunate to grab a table so quickly.

A few minutes later our waitress took our drink and appetizer orders.  They have very little available for children to drink - no juices other than what they use at the bar, and no milk.  For kids who don't like soda or plain water, there's not much choice.  My son ended up drinking nothing for the entire meal because he hates soda and they didn't have milk or juices available.

For the apps we ordered the mussels and the brussel sprouts.  The mussels were delicious and I could have eaten those all day long.  I found the brussel sprouts to be VERY bitter and could only eat 3-4 before the overwhelming bitterness became too much.

About five minutes after our appetizers arrived, the kids' food arrived at the table.  We finished our apps soon after that and then waited....and waited...and waited.  Our kids were halfway done with their food before our waitress came over to refill a glass and I asked where the food for the two adults was.  She said it was coming out next.

So we waited...and waited.  For about 30 more minutes.  By then our kids were long since done with their food, and getting bored just sitting there (thank heavens for phones with games galore!).  Methinks the waitress forgot to put in the complete order - that's the only thing I can think that would have caused such a major delay.  But we kept our smiles through the whole thing, continuing to keep the kids occupied while we waited.

FINALLY she brought out our food, and apologized for the long wait.  It's not like we ordered complicated food.  My husband got one of their standard crepes and I got a burger (having originally planned to have a dessert crepe).   There was NO REASON that burger and those crepes should have taken nearly 45 minutes to come out to the table (which was the time from when the appetizers were cleared away to when the food finally arrived).  Other tables around us were being served - including tables that arrived AFTER us.

Anyway, despite the wait, the food was good.  My husband enjoyed his crepe (spinach and mushrooms) and my burger was perfectly cooked and with amazing flavor.  

As we were finishing, our waitress came over and apologized for the long delay and said she would reduce our bill as an apology.  She also asked if we wanted a dessert crepe, but in the end we decided against it.  We didn't feel like waiting anymore and wanted to get back out into the sunshine to enjoy the rest of our day.

Will we go back?  Probably not.  While the food was good, it wasn't a meal that made us say, "WOW - WE HAVE TO GO BACK!"  Add in the slow service (the restaurant was always full, but surely they should be used to that given how few tables they have?) and it's not a place to which we'd return.

As a native New Orleanian and lover of crepes this place had my name written all over it. It was my friends birthday and we just ate dinner across the street and wanted a change of scenery. 

We walked up to the door to check it out. The hostesses(2) ignored us completely and yelled at the other couple that walked passed them to enter the restaurant. They really didn't understand their job description but I was already in love with this place so we didn't let that bother us and found the last 2 seats at the bar. Perfect! 

The bartender was awesome. Personable,knowlegable,everything you would want in a bartender. Ambiance is romantic,classy but loud. (Very small dining area with nothing to soak up the acoustics=loud. ) 

Not sure if the a/c was working but it felt about 80 degrees in there. 

We ordered the bananas fosters crepe with ice cream and 2 drinks. 
The sauce,fresh whipped cream,bananas,ice cream were all amazing except the crepe! The crepe was too thick,tasteless and chewy. Such a shame since the NAME of the place is CREPE cellar! Not sure if its the recipe or the cook but they gotta fix that. Overall we had a very nice experience.

2nd visit, stopped by after tasting beer next door for a quick bite with friends.  The place is tiny... so we sat at the bar instead.  I am not per se complaining, but as the 3rd wheel of the night, the bartender made it worse to totally skipping me as if I didn't even exist.  Oh well... I'll survive.  

I ordered a simple soup of the day (mushroom & leek) and it was oh so tasty.  I ended up eating my friends' pesto brie fries and I can see why it's a feature item.  It was like a combustion of so many flavors.  I also got a slice of their pizza/flatbread.  I didn't expect it to come on such a thick looking piece of bread, but it was moist yet crunchy on the outside.  All in all the food was 2-thumbs up... only thing is there's some serious garlic in all the items we ate, thank goodness I was the 3rd wheel and kissing wasn't on my agenda.

I can't wait to come back for the crepes... from what I recalled from my 1st visit a while back, they were yummy too

Easily one of Charlotte's best eats. Everything on their menu is amazing. Our first brunch experience was about a month ago and have been every Sunday since. Alex is one of the servers that never ceases to amaze. She is so kind and knowledgable. Definitely an asset to their team. Ask for her next time you're in on a Sunday. And as far as the food well...

A couple of must-haves:
Steak and eggs- get the grits and extra hollandaise sauce (trust me)
The bacon & shallot muscles (ask for more bread you're gonna need it)
And if you still have room... 
The crepe Suzette... to die for

We typically opt for mimosas at brunch but they have a variety of cocktails and craft beers.

Crepes, delicious crepes. Savory and sweet! And great beers on tap or if you prefer it, French press coffee.

Mrs. K and I popped in here on our way to north Charlotte and we were very pleased. She absolutely raved about the Crepe Suzette that she demolished while my crepe with duck confit and caramelized shallots was absolutely excellent. One pot of French press between us was enough to chase away the spiderwebs.

Great service, not too busy when we stopped in, and excellent food. All we need now is better parking!

Everything on the menu is fantastic. Try the Brussels sprouts first, accompanied by the mussel special of the day. The oysters are also delicious! Plus you can always expect a great beer, wine and liquor selection.

Did someone say Crepe?!?!?!

This place wasn't at all what I expected.  I regret that I have not returned to try a dessert crepe....or two!  In the heart of NoDa this was an impromptu stop to satisfy the need for dinner before heading out for beer with a friend and fellow Yelper.  At his suggestion, we grabbed a quick bite here vs. the crowded option across the street.  I was all around pleased with the atmosphere, service and menu options.  Wine and beer available along with daily specials.  The pesto brie fries are a must try.  The only downside was that the noise level, at least at dinner, was not conducive to casual conversation.

How do I love thee...let me count the ways:

1. Queen City Crêpe sans chicken/bacon is my go-to
2. Their fries are surprisingly delicious
3. Dessert crepes do not disappoint
4. Cellar cider, the component parts change seasonally, but occasionally contains Goldschläger
5. Arrive early, and you're more likely to be seated without a wait

It's really a NoDa mainstay, and every time I drive by I wonder why I'm not inside savoring a delicious crêpe.

Love the crepes here! They also have great specials, and a local favorite- the pesto Brie French fries. And if you get Colleen to make you a cocktail, you won't be dissatisfied. She can make a mean drink!

Updated Review!

Recently went back to Crepe Cellar and ordered the mussels--they were awesome. These were the standard mussels on the menu, and the sauce was awesome. We ordered extra bread to sop it up with, the flavor was perfect. We each ordered a savory crepe and really enjoyed them...along with parmesan fries! 

Great drink selection as always and the service was attentive and friendly. In general, I have been incredibly impressed with the customer service provided by the front of house staff as well as management, I'm happy to give my business to a restaurant that seems to truly appreciate customers.

If your in NoDa the Crepe Cellar is a good spot to eat. Typically I eat at Cabo FIsh Taco and go to Crepe Cellar for a dessert Crepe, but I have had some of the savory crepes here. In terms of crepes these are top notch. Ive been several times and intend to continue. There's even a bar in there if you want to have a drink but stay away from the noisy crowd.

Been here once and had a great experience.  I had a dessert crepe that was well prepared and abundant in chocolate, nutella, strawberries, nuts and fresh whip!  Crepe was perfectly thin, fluffy and delicate.  The filling was intense!  Exactly what i was looking for a Saturday brunch, paired with a cup of french pressed coffee.  Divine!  

Gotta go again and try some of the savory crepes.  To be continued.....  ;)

Great balls of fire! Found a new brunch spot. Yaye. They won me over from the time we walked in,from the host that greeted us at the door, to our waitress, and the fact that its in the noda art district. The young lady that was our waitress was more than nice and explained alot of the dishes on the menu even went on to tell us that their burger won the best burger and fries i want to say last year.

Our food  by no means we had no complaints! My friend ordered the award winning burger that she could not stop boasting about how good it was, and i ordered the chicken crepe and fries. When i say my food was so good it made you want to jump up and slap your mama! Some special sauce that i can not explain its taste drizzled on top of my crepe was so mouth drooling good. Please don't get me started on the chicken inside of the crepe, that was oh so juicy, tender, and tasty. My stomach is growling as i sit here speaking on all of this goodness we had here at Crepe Cellar.

Decor you ask? The vibe in here was real chill. The only part i hate that being that it was such a nice day i would have not minded if we sat on a patio but they don't have a patio here.Wooden unique wine case behind the booths was a nice touch with wine bottles set up for display and may have been for sale who knows. For everyone that hangs out in noda, rather you live here or you don't you most definitely want to come grab a meal here. Matter fact i think im going back this weekend.

Don't even hesitate.  Just go.  I've been 2-3 times in recent years (not nearly enough) and it's stellar each time, in both food and service.  The brussels sprouts are perfection in a bowl.  My date and I shared those and split a burger since neither of us was starving.  Now, I'm no burger connoisseur but on the rare occasion I order one I want it to be off the charts.  So often at restaurants I'm disappointed by the lack of flavor in the all American burger.  How hard can it be?  Well, Crepe Cellar nails it with their signature burger.  We ordered it medium rare, and it was absolutely, hands down, the best burger I've been served.  Anywhere.  Hated to share it.

The service is always good.  Never fawning, always comfortably attentive, and the servers are good at making suggestions.  I was considering a fun cocktail which is atypical for me, and they described it to a tee.  Delish!
Awful service, food is mediocre and overrated. They shouldn't call themselves a Crêpe shop when they cannot make a decent crepe period point blank. Would not recommend this establishment.

Loved the ambience. A little loud but still felt intimate. Mussels and Brie fries were great. The Arugula salad was good and interested flavor combo. The crepe we orderd was so so, would still return again.

Another special occasion means another visit to Crepe Cellar!! We have been coming to this place for several years now and it only gets better! The people who work here like our favorite, Catherine, always go out of their way to make you feel welcome and taken care of. We love coming here and appreciate the awesome vibe it always has. We have too many favorites to pick one, give it a try, you won't regret it!!

I went to crepe cellar on a Friday night with a friend. Had about an hour wait when we arrived. Being located in Noda it has a nice quaint feeling, small tables, close together. Almost too small for the demand. 

For my entree I got the spinach and wild mushroom savory buckwheat crepe and added chicken for an additional charge. I also substituted and got a house salad for my side item. The crepe was okay. It was nothing special. Before going, I was kind of not that into it because when I think of crepes I think of delicious dessert-y things like fruit and chocolate. But I decided to give the savory buckwheat crepes a try. I was not blown away. Everything tasted good, but it just wasn't something I would ever crave. The friend I was with ordered the rosemary and thyme roasted chicken. That was also good - but who goes to a crepe restaurant for a half a chicken? 

We split the banana fosters dessert crepe. Obviously this was the highlight of the meal. The crepe was cooked perfect, fresh bananas, good taste. Very rich of course. If I go back and I would just order ALL OF THE DESSERT CREPES. haha
Went in to have dinner for the first time here, but the hostess seemed annoyed, and wasn't very welcoming, so we left.

One of my favorite date spots. Oddly enough, I tend to avoid the crepes altogether - but everything else on the menu is always delicious. My personal favorites include the Burrata appetizer, the burger, brussel sprouts, and steak & guinness pie. They also have a great cocktail selection that changes seasonally. 

Cannot wait until their new southern concept restaurant opens down the street!

The place that originally brought me to NODA....what can I say about a place that has that much pull. 

It's a place that tops many of my lists including First Date, Best Burger, Top Fries, and to many others to list. 

I never understood just how important this restaurant was to my pallet until I broke away from the crêpes. For the first year of dining here, I didn't order anything other then there crapes. I have now found that their are other food is absolutely unbelievable.  I'm not one to recommend particular dishes since food is such a personal desire; however, I do feel the need to point out that their burger and chicken Cordon Bleu Sandwich is a must try if you never have had it.
